The Wolf Clan
A proud and noble people, hardened by the icy winds of their native land, the Northern Needles. Even among their enemies, they are respected for their devotions to concepts like tradition and honor. They are a secretive society, and mostly keep to themselves; however, if trifled with, the entire pack will descend upon their enemies with ruthless efficiency...

Thane
Fight: 5 | Body: 5 | Wits: 3 | Spirit: 3
Thane, fun-loving and crass, was often considered unsuited for the serious and spiritual lifestyle of the Wolf Clan. His father looked down on him, considering his brother, Fang, to be the preferred leader of their prestigious clan. But when his brother succumbed to the rot, and his father passed away in his old age, Thane suddenly found himself thrust, unprepared, into power. His unwitting reign was immediately met with outrage by the wolf peoples, who balked at the thought of having such an incompetent chieftain in such a dire time. If Thane wants to win the support of his people, he must slay the mad king, and unite the clans together under the banner of the wolf...

River
Fight: 4 | Body: 5 | Wits: 4 | Spirit: 3
Known among the villagers of the frigid north as the Lone Wolf. When she is called upon, she disappears deep behind enemy lines, not to be seen nor heard from for years at a time. She strikes with surgical precision; her foes never see it coming, and their disappearances go seemingly unexplained, often assumed to be simple accidents. Some think she's simply a myth. Some consider her the greatest ranger the clan has ever known. Whatever the truth may be, the enemies of the Wolf Clan often check over their shoulders for the she-wolf, and those she targets can only huddle in fear as they are picked off one by one...

Magna
Fight: 5 | Body: 6 | Wits: 3 | Spirit: 2
Not much is known about this hero. Despite having led some of the proudest warriors of the Wolf Clan into glorious battles, the codes of secrecy wolf warriors swear by means that detailed knowledge of her exploits is mostly remembered only by the grand she-wolf herself. Whispers among the lower ranks, however, indicate the she-wolf is absolutely merciless and unbreakable in battle, and that she has an unnerving penchant for wearing the tails of slain foes as trophies.

Fang
Fight: 6 | Body: 5 | Wits: 3 | Spirit: 2
Not much is known about this hero. It is known that he's the brother of Thane, and in contrast to his sibling, was a bright and noble wolf, once thought to be the future chieftain of the clan. Alas, his time was cut short. The details of his death are controversial. Some believe he was killed by a lucky shot from a bandit's arrow; some believe he fell ill with a mysterious disease; and some even dare to heretically suggest that he was one of the first to be infected by the rot. Worse still, rumors on the outskirts of Armello claim that Fang is actually still alive, but corrupted by the rot, wandering the wilderness consumed by madness and spreading chaos wherever he goes.

111.content:
You take in a deep breath through your nose, and wrinkle it in disgust before exhaling through your mouth. Today is the day you set out to put and end to the Rot and all this madness. Ever since the King had made his declaration, the Rot had been free to spread across Armello, and now that some of the wolf clan members are getting infected, it's become a problem. Wolves have sensitive noses after all, even a single Rot infected citizen with only one or two rot points can clear a building here! There are only a few Rot infected people in the clan, but it's enough to stink up the whole place! At least, to a wolf that is.

Eager to leave the smell behind and get some fresh air, you order the guards to open the gate and allow you to leave the Clan Grounds. You can only hope that this place won't succumb to the Rot while you're gone. After all, you are the leaving this place leaderless. Still, this Rot isn't going away on its own, and you won't just let it swallow up your people. You haven't been leader long, and you aren't very experienced, but even you can see that this is the best thing for your people!

One of the guards salutes you as you pass. "Good luck, sir! Hopefully you can find a way to cleanse this Rot before we all end up snout-deep in each other's boots. He shudders at the thought, and you do as well. After a brief exchange, you step outside and the gates are shut behind you.

The cold, wind blows up from the base of the Northern Needles. Strange magics have kept most of the land in an eternal summer, but the snowy peaks that the Wolf Clan call home remain cold as ever. It takes you most of the day to climb down, which is fine by you. You fight better in the dark anyways. As you reach the warm ground outside of Wolf territory, the fresh mountain air you'd enjoyed on the way down is replaced by the stench of Rot once again. You groan and hold your nose as you check your surroundings.

You can see a town off to the East. It'd be a good place to check for more information about the Rot, or just quests you can take for money. To the direct south are some old ruins, a dungeon you could explore. And finally, there's a forest to the East. There's probably not much there save for bandits, or perhaps one of the other people that clan scouts had said are looking to defeat the king.

111.title: Thane

112.content:
For the past few years, you’ve been on a campaign to wipe out a bandit tribe that has been growing in the Northern Needles. It was a powerful organization, a few thousand strong, but you’ve been dismantling it piece by piece, assassinating its leaders, setting fire to its strongholds and picking off its underlings one by one. Over the years, the tribe has been plunged into chaos, and its remaining members have deserted the tribe, fearing for their lives. Now, after years of work, you’ve single-handedly destroyed the bandit organization like you have so many others, resigning it to the annals of history…

When you returned home, however, you were not given much time to rest before you were sent on a new campaign. You’ve tried to keep out of Armello’s affairs… but the rot has slowly been creeping into your work more and more. It seems to be omnipresent; there’s not a place you could go to escape its influence. It seems like the once noble kingdom has gone made. If you wanted things to return to the way they were, you were going to have to stomp out this chaos; starting with its very source...

The rot infects each of us its victims with their own unique, foul stench, which seems to grow worse as the infection grows. This is embarrassing enough, but the true cost is the way it affects your personality. The more points of rot you have, the more you’re controlled by your own id; those who are corrupted become horny, smelly, slobbish versions of their former selves. Truly, in a culture dedicated to honor, chastity and temperance, becoming infected with the rot is the most humiliating fate a wolf could suffer. Thus, usually when a once proud wolf is corrupted, it is kept a secret, and they are mercifully, silently exiled to preserve their honor…

During your last campaign, you’ve run into a few corrupted exiles while travelling the wilderness. The ones whose willpower was strong were still relatively normal, and seemed embarrassed and ashamed by their smelly tendencies and sinful urges. The ones whose willpower was weak were now mindless slobs, who immediately tried to fuck and/or fart on you on sight, only to get an arrow through the skull instead. In truth, it hurt your soul to find that so many of your fellow wolves have succumbed to such a terrible affliction. And then you come home, only to learn that your king has succumbed to the madness as well!?

You were never at all interested in Armello’s politics. Hell, you weren’t much of a people person in general. The concept of ‘loneliness’ never registered with you. Being completely isolated, all by yourself, deep in the wilderness for months at a time was relaxing to you. But hearing about the madness of the king, and seeing the other similarly mad, completely unqualified ‘heroes’ who were vying for the crown, you knew you had to embark on the most difficult, the most dangerous, and the most important campaign of your life...

If Armello, in its sensitive state, falls into the wrong hands, it is doomed. You cannot risk that happening. You must travel the lands, pool your resources, spread word of your prestige, and become the new queen of the kingdom. There was no doubt in your mind that you will, over the course of your campaign, be infected with your rot. In fact, in order to succeed, you will likely have to harness the rot’s dark powers to your own ends. You will have to sacrifice your honor, your chastity, your temperance, and perhaps even your very sanity… but all the suffering you will endure was worth guaranteeing a brighter future for your kingdom.

You had only a couple weeks to prepare. You liked to plan out every detail before acting, but you didn’t have time for that. If you were going to seize the throne, you were going to have to react to whatever obstacles you may face along the way, and rely on your wits and skill to guide you. While preparing to set out, you notice a few opportunities to gain some extra prestige, and maybe a bit of gear...

While at a library, you hear a few bear sages discuss what sounds like it may be a proper Wits Challenge. Apparently, a spirit stone on a nearby mountain was harming the natural balance of the region, and someone needs to go retrieve it. You’ve heard that these mysterious ‘spirit stones’ can be used to completely banish the rot, which intrigued you...

While at a bar, you overhear a few drunkards discussing a possible Fights Challenge. The king’s madness has left the kingdom destabilized, and opportunistic bandits and brigands have been taking advantage of the chaos. Apparently, a small group of bandits have taken over a nearby trade route, and have been charging travelling caravans ‘gold’ with the threat of burning their wagons. If you wiped out this group, perhaps you could even claim some treasure for yourself...

Lastly, you’ve heard rumors that seems like they could lead to a Spirit Challenge. Apparently, the king is holding some kind of festival nearby, but there have been whispered rumors that the festival is actually a front, and the entire thing is just a plan to corrupt a few high-ranking aristocrats with rot. If you put a stop to this plan, you could probably recruit some grateful noble to your cause...

1121.content:
As much as you want to help with the bandit problem, if these Spirit Stones can really do what people say, they'll be a far more permanent solution to the troubles plaguing Armello. If things go well and the trip is a short one, you may even be able to come back here and deal with the bandits after you get the stone. After making a few preparations and checking your map to ensure which way you need to go to reach the mountains, you head off.

According to your map, the mountains are just past a swamp to the west. Of course, you could also go through the forests around the swamp, but that'll take almost half a day to get around them and then climb the mountain. Swamps are dangerous, vile places. Some people have said that swamps are places where the Rot has sunk into the soil and befouled the landscape. Of course, it's likely untrue. The swamps had all been here long before the first cases of Rot were ever reported. Still, they are foul, and you're likely to take at least some damage in there, be it from plants, insects, or just the smell. As for bandits and marauders, well, the forests are just as likely to hold people like that. The forests would give you cover and allow you to sneak up on such people though. Hell, you may even be able to find someone to help you in some capacity.

As you step out of town, you look at the branching road. One leads off through those forest trails, and another straight on to the swamp. Both paths have their ups and downs. The forest path is arguably safer, but it'll take longer to reach your quest. The swamp is faster, but you're all but guaranteed to take some damage going through there!

It takes you a moment, but you finally make your decision as you start walking down...

1121.title: Wits Challenge

1123.content:
Your ambitions here were higher then petty brigands and sage superstitions. You wanted to quell the rot. For some reason, the mad king seemed to want to spread the corruption, until everyone in the kingdom was as smelly and hedonistic as he was. Thus, it wouldn’t surprise you if this festival he was holding really was just a conspiracy to propagate the vile plague. The only thing causing you any hesitation was the fact that these rumors might be just that; rumors. If there was any chance at all that you might save someone from the dreaded fate of corruption, though, you must take it.

The trip to the festival would take you far from your homelands. You spend around eight hours or so quietly travelling on foot along plains and prairies, doing your best to avoid being spotted by anyone despite being far out of your comfort zone. Eventually, you finally make it to the forest where the festival is being held, just as the sun was about to set in the distance. Now, this was more like it! You were at home in the forests of Armello, especially at night, when the thick canopy completely veils you in darkness and makes you feel practically invisible. Traveling through the forest unseen and unheard was soothing to you, and you made much quier progress.

Eventually, halfway through the night, you finally come across the festival buried deep in the woods. It was difficult to miss; it’s bright lights and gaudy opulence could be seen over the trees for miles around. Growing closer, you can hear the cacophony of laughter and music as the nobles within celebrate. Once you got a good look at it, the festival was indeed an impressive and dazzling spectacle… but that only made you loathe it more. How could these aristocrats be partying and celebrating while peasants are succumbing to the rot as we speak? Out of sight, out of mind, you suppose.

As you step onto the festival grounds and wander around, you realize just how out of place you must look here. All the other guests were wearing stylish suits and beautiful gowns, and you were still donning your ranger uniform. It didn’t take long for one of the security guards to notice you didn’t belong here. “Hey! Wolf!” You hear a voice shout behind you, and you stop. “You look like you’re not supposed to be here. Why don’t you just turn around and-” The words were caught in his throat as you turned around to face him. He was a little weasel man, and from the look of it, he was stunned to see a legendary warrior show up at an event like this.

“... R-River…?” He gasps, recognizing you. Once he realizes just who he was speaking to, he immediately seemed apologetic, almost terrified. “I-I’m sorry, miss. I didn’t mean nothing by it, really! Please, enjoy yourself!” He stuttered, staring into your cold, stoic eyes. Apparently, your reputation precedes you, and you could terrify people into submission with a single, unimpressed glance. This knowledge was useful, for sure. The otter breathes a sigh of relief when you turn away from him, thinking he’s just been spared your wrath.

You wander around, glancing at stages full of exotic belly dancers and amusing jester acts, before finally happening across what you were looking for; the king’s mages. They were mysterious figures of various species all cloaked in robes, hiding their faces as they moved furtively through the crowd. Raising a brow, you decide to tail them from a distance, your senses telling you they were definitely up to something or another. You did not know exactly how the rot was spread, but if they were brewing it here, you had to put a stop to it at all costs.

Eventually, they disappeared into one of the big, strange teepee-like tents, with two guards taking their places at the entrance. Eager to see what was going on within, you climb easily up onto the roof of a nearby hut at the tent’s back. A few people gave you funny looks when you started climbing things, but they figured you were just a particularly drunk guest, and laughed it off. You keep one hand on your dagger as you approach one of the gaps in the top of their tent, remaining completely silent as you peak down on them.

You realize with a start that they were in the process of some kind of ritual! A few were kneeling along a the sides of a glowing, purple ritual circle, while the magus was standing in the center, guiding their almost whispered chant. The circle grows brighter and brighter as they chant, and you can sense it harnessing potent dark magic. It seemed to be slowly infecting everyone at the carnival with the rot!

You only had seconds to act. You could either tear down the tent with your dagger, exposing the ritual being performed and causing the festival to be evacuated. This might take a while, however, and during the evacuation, a few people might still get infected. Meanwhile, it would be a lot faster to just jump down and slay some of the mages, preventing them from completing their ritual. However, this runs the risk of getting you infected yourself...
1123.title: The Festival

11232.content:
You figure that evacuating immediately would be the safest thing to do… but to your horror, you notice a purple gas slowly start to emerge from the ritual circle, glowing with dark magic. There was no time to evacuate! You had to stop this ritual now! You immediately nock your arrow, aim it at the mage that gave you the clearest shot, and let it fly! Like always, your aim was true, and your arrow plunged through the warlock’s head, killing him instantly and stopping the ritual in its tracks. While the rest of them were looking around, confused, you took advantage of the opportunity and immediately fired off two more arrows, downing two of more of the mages.

Before you could fire off another shot, though, the head magus looked up and noticed you peeking in through the gap in the tent. Now that her hood was down, you noticed she was some sort of black bear, and she looked quite angry. You try to nock another arrow, but it was too late; the bear reared back and fired a burst of black magic at you, sending you flying off the hut you were standing on! You land on the ground a few meters away, battered and shaken by the occult energy. Hearing the commotion, the crowd filling the festival all ran away screaming and hollering.

While you lie there on the ground, trying to shake off the effects of the dark magic, the security guards rush towards the tent, only to be easily slaughtered by the bear. By the time you finally climb back up to your feet, the bear was towering over you, her veins black and her eyes glowing purple with dark energy. You pull out a dagger, and immediately swing it at her… only for her to dodge your attack with unbelievable speed! She immediately countered by elbowing you in the back, a simple blow which somehow sent you flying into a nearby tree!

You kept trying to fight her, but your every attack was easily countered, and her every attack did devastating damage. How was this possible? You’ve defeated some of the strongest bandits in Armello with ease, and yet this simple bear was wiping the floor with you. Then, you realized… it must be the rot! You’ve heard being infected with the rot can improve your fighting skill. Perhaps, being a prioress of the rot, she was so heavily infected that she had now achieved a level of strength and speed no normal mammal would be capable of? Your blood ran cold when you realized the rot could have such an effect!

Your attempts to fight proved futile, and your attempts to flee proved even moreso. Soon, you were battered and bruised on the ground before her, a legendary warrior humiliated by being beaten by such a simple mage. As if to add insult to injury, now that the bear was standing over you, her foul stench was burning at your nostrils. “Fool! Interrupting our ritual? I would kill you… but you’re a champion of the wolf clan, are you not? Your people would just revive you,” she grinned. “No. Instead, I will teach you… the glory of the Rot.” You watched, confused, as she hitched up her robes, turning around and revealing her huge, thick booty.

You immediately flinched at what sounded like the bear letting loose a small fart. But it was no ordinary fart, no; in fact, there seemed to be a cloud of visible purple gas wafting from the bear’s booty… the same gas the ritual circle had been emitting! That was some kind of dark magic! Realizing what the bear had planned for you, and knowing you can’t possibly overpower her, you do the only thing you could think of; clamp your hands together and pray to the Wyld. You weren’t a very spiritual purpose, but you immediately start whispering every prayer you could think of, desperate to counter her dark magic.

The bear was just about to sit down on you, but seeing what you were trying, she pauses, seemingly amused. “Hah! Praying for a miracle, now? Pathetic,” she cackles, rolling her eyes. “Hmm… let’s see if your pitiful Wyld is going to save you, shall we?” She stands there, towering over you, taunting you with her fat booty as you frantically pray for help…

Your spirit is being tested! Do you succeed?
11232.title: Attack the Mages! (High Risk)

112321.content:
The sadistic, corrupted rot priestess seemed amused by your desperate, whispered prayers, apologizing to the Wyld for not being very faithful and begging it for aid against the darkness. Eventually, there’s a sudden gust of wind, which fills your heart with hope! … but, it turns out to be just that; wind. Seeing the hopeless look on your face, the bear rears back and lets out a long, guttural laugh. “Hmm! I guess your ‘Wyld’ isn’t going to help you after all…” She eventually cackles, looking back down on you with a smug, toothy glare. “But don’t worry. You don’t need the Wyld anymore. Soon, you will become one with the rot…”

You notice her lift her huge butt over you, and you immediately try to wriggle out from under her, but it’s far too late. Before you can flee, she drops herself down on you all at once, her immense weight crashing down on your face! Your screams are muffled by ass flesh as your snout is pressed up between her big, pillowy cheeks. She was heavy, but her booty was so soft and squishy that getting sat on wasn’t painful; simply humiliating. You grab onto her doughy rump cheeks, desperately trying to push her off of you, only resulting in her giggling.

“Mm! You know, you actually make a comfy cushion, mutt!” She taunted, bouncing and grinding her booty on your face, the sadistic ursine taking great pleasure in your every muffled scream. Eventually, she wriggles her hips until your nose is pressed right up against her puckered hole, causing you to whimper in terror. “Ready down there, sweetheart?” She cackles. You start squirming with renewed vigor, realizing the bear’s about to ‘break wind’. No luck. All you can do is brace yourself before the bear unleashes an achingly loud and powerful, enchanted fart right into your nostrils!

You were almost paralyzed by the sheer disgust as the purple gas covered your face and filled your nose. You knew the rot was foul, but this was, by far, the worst thing you’ve ever smelled in your life! You once had to hide out in the sewers of the Rat Capital for a week… and yet this, somehow, smells ten times worse! To make matters worse, you can feel the rot creeping up your nostrils and infecting your body, filling you with nausea and malaise! Eventually, you work up the strength to start struggling for dear life again, but this, of course, continues to have no effect on the much larger bear.

“Mm. Not a fan of the stench of rot, huh?” The bear cackled. “Don’t worry. You’ll learn to love it eventually…” Eventually, your nostrils have inhaled every last bit of the strange purple gas… which she took as a cue to let out yet another heinous fart! You let out a muffled scream as the agony starts all over again! You’ve only been under her for a few seconds, and yet it felt like hours. She spent the next couple of minutes bouncing her rump on your face while letting out enchanted fart after fart, making 100% sure you’ll be infected. Eventually, the security guard’s back-up shows up, which the bear takes as a sign that she should leave.

“See you, ‘hero’!” She mocked, before disappearing in a cloud of purple smoke, leaving you lying there, dazed and confused. The stench of the gas had not only seared your nostrils, but worked its way up to your brain and made your entire head feel numb. Eventually, one of the back-up guards rushes over to your side.

“Miss! Are you alright?” He asked, reaching out a hand. With a groan, you take his hand, and he slowly pulls you to your feet, letting you lean up against his shoulder. You walked with him for a few seconds, letting him take you towards an infirmary… but then, a thought strikes you. Were you… infected? Even with your foggy, addled mind, terror wells up in your chest, and you look down and part the fur on the wrist… only to see that your veins were, indeed, running black.

Overwhelmed with horror, you pass out on the spot…

…

…

…

Eventually, you wake up lying on a comfy bed, and for a moment, you have a hopeful thought that, perhaps, the horror you had just experienced had all been a dream. No such luck. You lazily slid open your eyes, only to find yourself in some sort of makeshift infirmary, with an armadillo woman looking down on you.

“Ah! Glad to see you’re okay, dear. It seems like you’ve been through quite a lot,” the nurse says. She seems to be speaking in a strange voice, and you wonder why… until you notice the nose clip she has on her snout. Of course! You were infected now, you must smell awful! Alarmed, you almost jolt out of bed, only to succumb to a sudden wave of exhaustion. “Easy, there. You’re probably still going to be a little groggy.”

“Tell me. Am I… infected?” You asked immediately. She grimaced, pausing for a moment.

“I’m afraid so. You have a full point of rot,” she sheepishly admits. “Don’t worry, it’s not contagious. However, many people will probably find it… ‘unpleasant’ to be around you for very long,”

You sigh, looking down at your paws. “Oh, by the four clans…”

Seeing the look on your face, she leans forward and lays a paw on your shoulder, offering a reassuring smile. “Now, don’t panic. It’s not the end of the world,” she soothes you. “Many infected individuals still manage to live full, happy lives, despite their affliction...”

You move away from her, pulling her hand off your shoulder and silencing her little speech. “I… I knew this was going to happen. Just… not so soon…” you sigh. Come to think of it, a strange smell did seem to be filling your nostrils. You lift an arm and sniff your armpit, to realize that the smell was, indeed, coming from you. However, it actually smelled strangely pleasant, despite having the sting of the rot. “I… don’t smell that bad…”

“Oh, everyone who is infected is afflicted with their own, unique stench,” the nurse explains. “It will smell pleasant to you, but to everyone else, it’s a very different story.”

You experimented with your stench for a while, curiously sniffing at your own body odor. You quickly notice another concern, though; the aching, burning desire in your loins. “Urgh… its feels like I’m in heat…” You whimper, crossing your legs.

“Ah! Yes, lust is another symptom,” she nods. She starts spouting something else, but your mind is too distracted fantasizing about forcing her down on her knees and having her eat your unwashed, smelly muff. You indulge in these fantasies for a while… but eventually, disturbed by these thoughts, you suddenly stand up out of bed and make for the door!

“I-I’m feeling well, now!” You said, fleeing outside before she had the opportunity to say anything else. “My sincere thanks!” She can only watch with mild concern as you hurry away, rushing out into the forests, desperate to be alone right now. Eventually, you settle down leaned up against on the thicker trees, pondering your situation. You were supposed to be an unbeatable and noble warrior… and yet, you were humiliated - corrupted - by a single mage. Were you past your prime? Had you been careless? Could your sense of honor ever recover?

You huff, reminding yourself to look at the bright side. This was a learning experience. Now that you’ve experienced first-hand the true power of the rot, you’ve realized that this will be the greatest trial you’ve ever had to overcome in all your years. Besides, you still managed to rescue countless party guests from being corrupted, which has earned you some gold and prestige. After praying to the Wyld so passionately, you now feel a strange affinity towards it, and generally feel more spiritual. Most of all, the rot flowing through your veins seems to have increased your strength and speed…

You still had a problem to attend to, though. With a whimper, you look around, making sure nobody was there, before hiking up your armored skirt and beginning to rub at your clit with a paw. Your sex was now extremely sensitive, and this simple act immediately reduced you to a blushing, panting, gasping mess. While you played with yourself, all sorts of deviant and perverted fantasies flashed through your head. Dominating some measly bandit… sucking off one of your fellow wolf warriors… maybe even sitting on that bastard Thane’s face and farting him unconscious, just as that bear had done to you…

With these thoughts, it only took a few minutes for you to reach climax. You were barraged by a brief flood of ecstasy… followed by a deluge of shame. What was wrong with you!? You were supposed to be chaste… honorable! Were you letting the rot take over your mind already? Even though the rot may give you incredible strength, you couldn’t let it cause you to forget who you are.

As the sun rises, you make your way into a nearby village, where species of all shapes and sizes were living in relative harmony. River despaired at how people shied away in disgust as she passed by, feeling a piercing sense of self-loathing settle in her heart. Eventually, though, one dedicated squirrel courier walked eagerly up to her. “River! I figured you’d turn up around here!” The squirrel smiles, apparently excited to find you. “Listen; many in your clan are ecstatic to hear that you’re vying for the crown! In fact, they’ve offered some provisions to help you on your campaign…”

“Provisions?” You raise a brow. “Of what sort?”

He gives you an amused look. “Well, that depends on what you’re interested in…”
112321.title: Failure

1123211.content:
Trickeries have never really been your thing. After all, most of the Wolf Clan views bribing officials and hiring thugs as extremely dishonorable. And honestly, after last night, you feel you've seen enough magic to last a lifetime. That said, you DO feel more in touch with the Wyld than before...perhaps one spell couldn't hurt.

"How many provisions are you allowed to give to me, exactly?" You inquire. The squirrel, thankfully, seems to be unaffected by your stench. Either that or he's too afraid to risk upsetting you.

The courier smiles and adjusts his pack, "four. Any combination of the three is fine, but I can't spare everything! I've got to provide for Thane and Magna as well! Then the rest of this stuff has to go back to the clan!" Thane...figures he'd be questing for the crown. Maybe he's finally starting to take his job seriously, or more likely he's using this as an excuse to get away from said job and swing his sword at people. Magna though...you hadn't expected the leader of the Iron Guard to leave the clan, even for a quest to restore the land. You'd never met or seen her, but you've heard plenty from another shieldmaiden who had contracted the Rot and had exiled herself to your mountain. She's a hulking beast of a woman who decorates her armor with the tails of vanquished foes. Normally you'd consider these two allies, but now that you've contracted rot, well...Thane might still try to help you cure yourself, but Magna would probably cut you down where you stand.

You shake the thought from your head and turn back to the courier, "I'll take one spell scroll. The rest in equipment." The squirrel man nods and rummages around in that pack of his. The thought of fucking him briefly crosses your mind, but you push it away as he turns back to you. He hands you a scroll first, the label on it reads "Mesmerize" and it appears to cost 4 Magic to cast. He then hands you two cards and a rather warm waterskin.

"You remember how item cards work, right? Magical cards that depict items held in various stores? Just press some gold pieces against 'em until you've paid for the item, and said item will come through! They make it sooo much easier on couriers than actually lugging around a million pounds of steel."

You look down at the two cards. A steel sword for two gold, and an Adventurer's Kit for one. You stow them away for now and eye the warm flask. "What about this, then?"

He said it burns going down, but it'll make you substantially faster for the day! Consider it a gift from...er, someone who wants you to succeed in your quest!"

1123211.title: Item

11232111.content:
You open the waterskin and sniff its contents, before shying away distastefully. It smells like… rot. No thanks. You definitely don’t feel like your increasing your rot any more yet. You tuck it into your bag.

You thank the courier for his hard work finding you, and then tuck yourself away somewhere where no one would have to deal with your stench. With that, you start inspecting the cards he gave you, intrigued by this new magic. Do these things really work? Curiously, you take out a coin and press it against one of the cards… only for the coin to disappear! Now, the card says that the item only costs one more coin. Fascinated, you press another coin against it… only for the card to suddenly glow brightly! Startled, you drop it on the ground, staring at its incredibly, magical glow.

Eventually, you notice the handle of a sword sticking out from the bright glow. You hesitantly bend over and grab it, pulling a sword up and out of the ball of light. Eventually, you’ve retrieved the sword completely, and the light disappears, the card gone with it. With an intrigued coo, you inspect the sword. twirling it around with your paws and getting used to its weight and balance. It seemed to be in absolutely pristine condition, and was so sparkling and shiny, you could see your reflection in its blade. With a satisfied smile, you tuck your new sword into its sheath at your side.

For a moment, you ponder what to do with your dagger… until you notice a few wolf cubs staring at you, seemingly bubbling with excitement on seeing you. You must be some sort of hero to them! With a chuckle, you walk over and offer them your dagger, and the cubs immediately start cheering in excitement that they were given a dagger used by the legendary Silver herself. With that, they rush off, eager to brag about this to everyone they know. You wave happily as they run off, before turning around and looking back at your cards again. Summoning that sword was pretty cool; you wanted to try it again!

You look down at the other card; the Adventurer’s Kit. Always useful! Without much thought, you press another coin against it. This time, you managed to retrieve a bunch of basic adventuring gear from your bag, seeming like it’s designed to aid you in all manner of situations. You tuck this all away in your bag, contented.

Miles away, in the distance, you hear a loud roar...

Kings Declaration: Rot Inspection!


You rest there for a while, until eventually, two strange figures in robes approach you. They’re both wearing plague masks shaped like the beak of a crow, and carrying strange incense. Eventually, they come to a stop in front of you, making you nervous. “Have no fear, ranger. The king has simply demanded an inspection for rot of every champion of the four clans…” Your blood runs cold in your veins. If the king learned you’d been infected with the rot, he would make sure everyone in the kingdom knows! But… there was no escaping from the rot inspectors. No point in delaying the inevitable.

You grimly but obediently consent to their inspection. They probe you with all manner of strange apparatus and inspect your blackened veins, whispering to eachother. Eventually, one of them chuckles creepily, his raspy voice echoing in his mask. “Well, well, well…” He notes, as if amused as he looks over the results. “The legendary ranger of the wolf clan… succumbing to the rot.”

You whimper and stare at the ground, your ears drooping in shame. The two doctors seemed amused by this. “Oh, don’t feel too bad. All of you wolf champions are infected, by this point.” The other waved his hand, dismissively. “It’s the obvious consequence of trying to fight the king of rot…”

“W-what?” You look up at him, surprised. “M-Magna’s been infected, too?”

“Oh, yes, even more so than you are. In fact, I’d wager a guess that she infected herself intentionally.” You were stunned! Magna… infecting herself with a rot? Such a thing seemed completely impossible. Why would she ever do such a thing? Seeing your confusion, the inspector continues. “The rot is a powerful and dangerous tool. Extremely so. If you want any chance of being the one to overthrow the mad king, you’re going to have to harness the rot for your own ends. But this, I’m sure, you already know.”

You sigh. You do already know that. If you want to save the kingdom of Armello, you’re going to have to sacrifice your pride, your honor, and even your very sanity, giving it all over to the rot. But for what end, you wondered? What’s the point of replacing one rotten ruler with another? Was the rot so powerful, it was truly the only path to the throne? While the inspectors walked off to report their finders, you laid there in unparalleled despair, feeling hopeless. Now, everybody in the kingdom would know you have the rot, decreasing your prestige back to zero…

Eventually, a report on the rot infection of each champion is given to every citizen of Armello:

Brun … 3
??? … 3
Magna … 2
Scarlet … 2
Barnaby … 2
Thane … 1
Sylas … 1
Amber … 1
Mercurio … 1
The Rest … 0


Looking down at the waterskin, you remember something. That inspector claims Magna is already more infected than you? You could only wonder at how corrupted Thane is by this point, not to mention the countless other champions from the other clans. If you wanted to keep up, you were going to have to be fast. Relentless. You were going to have to embrace the rot. With a sigh, you pulled out the waterskin, pressed it to your lips, and took a big swig. It burned the hell out of your throat, but somehow you managed to chug it all down. You immediately dropped it afterwards, shuddering at the sensation filling your body.

You feel… rotten. There was a nausea brewing in your belly, you felt even hornier, and your stench noticeably increased. But on the other hand, you feel… powerful. The rot flowed through your vein, making you stronger, faster… better! Who cares about a bit of stench when compared to such power! You immediately spring to your feet, filled with dedication! For the people of Armello, you would not fail! With that, you drop on all fours and break into a sprint for a while, travelling far from the small village and descending back into the depths of the forest…

There, in the wilderness, you meet an old crone that agrees to tell you a bit about the local rumors.

Up in the nearest mountain range, she hears tales of a potential Wits Challenge. When she mentions the name ‘Vekkius’, you immediately perk up. Vekkius… the two of you had been friends once, and you had been truly in awe of his skill in battle. He inspired you to dedicate yourself wholly to the trade of a ranger... but eventually, he tragically disappeared, and has not been seen since. Apparently, though, rumors claim that he’s been spotted living a reclusive life up in the mountains, for some reason. It would be a great boon for the Wolf Clan if you found him. However, she warns that a champion of the bear clan happens to be wandering that very same mountain range…

Meanwhile, in the villages dotting the wolf territory, there seemed to be a potential Fight Challenge. Somehow, through some legal loopholes and bureaucratic trickery, a cabal of felines have somehow made themselves rulers of a small village of wolves. Infected with the rot, these felines have been using their positions of authority to sadistically torment the poor villagers. Now, they’re barring anyone from exiting or entering the village, so they can abuse the villagers with impunity. If you were to liberate the village, it would reopen a few trade routes for the clan. However, she warns that a champion of the rabbit clan happens to be stopping by that very same village…

Lastly, in the meanwhile fertid, miserable swamps, she thinks you might have the opportunity for a Body Challenge. A caravan travelling through the swamps has been stranded and maddened by the clouds of rot that often burst from its waters. Many of them are corrupted and overcome by lust and insanity, but it is believed that there might be a few survivors among the wreckage that have only sustained meager doses of the rot. If you rescued them, their families would be eternally grateful. However, she warns that a champion of the rat clan happens to be travelling through that very same swamp…

Rot infected cats ruling over a wolf town is bad enough, but a Rabbit Clan champion encroaching on Wolf territory just makes matters even worse! You trek through the forests all day without issue, though you do hear from a group of passing traders (before they stop talking to keep from breathing in your stink) that apparently, monstrous beings called Banes are coming out of ruins and dungeons every night. You'd heard a bit about these creatures, at least one wolf exile had been infected by one. However, you thought they only took the shape of giant crows. The one the traders spoke of is apparently a big, feral skunk terrorizing another town that the traders had fled from. Ugh, the more you hear about the Rot, the more you wish you could get rid of it. Unfortunately, embracing it seems to be the best way to achieve your goal.

By nightfall, the town has come into view. The whole place is surrounded by massive stone walls now! What on earth happened here!? You get your answer fairly soon when you get closer to the front gate. You see a rabbit woman with a feathered, yellow beret and an ornate warhammer. Elyssia...the Wardress of the Warrens...a master architect who's said to be able to fortify an entire town in a day. No doubt, that's exactly what she did here, and given that a rot-marked tiger woman is currently putting a coin pouch in her hands...you know WHY she did it too.

As Elyssia walks down the road, away from the village and towards you, you immediately walk up to her and snarl. "So much for rabbits caring about border treaties. How dare you help an outside force invade and enslave our people!?

Elyssia wrinkles her nose at the stench coming off of your rot-afflicted body and roughly shoves you aside! "Out of my way, disgusting beast! I'd have thought that maybe a so-called champion of your people would have some common decency, but it seems you're just like the rest. A disgusting, flea-ridden mongrel that doesn't deserve the respect others so readily foist on your clan. Tell me, how does it feel to know that the entire kingdom knows that the "great" ranger, River has sold her dignity for the power of Rot like a cheap whore? Every one of your champions has succumbed to the Rot. You don't deserve to rule, and I'll be damned if I just sit by and let you!"

Every word this lapine has just uttered makes you violently angry. Between your superior fighting skill AND Rot, you could easily take her down a peg! Though, that Mesmerize scroll is just begging for you to use it. You could force her to serve the very clan she despises so much!

1123211121.content:
Another symptom of the rot was increased aggression. That is to say, you wanted to absolutely destroy this bitch! The expression on your face remained stoic as ever, but fury was festering within your bosom. Elyssia started to walk away, cackling after having taunted you, but as she left, you nocked it an arrow and fired it right into her back! This would be enough to defeat any normal warrior… but being a champion, to her credit, Elyssia mostly tanked the blow, though it did sting her a little. “H-hey! Cheap shot! Aren’t you wolves supposed to be honorable?” She’s forgetting that wolves believe that, in combat, the only honor is in victory… through any means. With that, you nocked another arrow.

Seeing that you had had enough of her prattle, she drops her up-tight demeanor, and immediately charges at you with her huge, strange warhammer-like staff. Being a rabbit, she hops forward with surprising speed, and she immediately closes the distance between before you can let loose another arrow. With a growl, you toss your bow aside, and draw your sword...

Elyssia Rolls…
2 Hits, 1 Block
River Rolls…
6 Hits, 1 Block


She attacks before you have the opportunity to. She tries to bring her staff down on your head, but you manage to block it with your sword, managing to tug her staff from her grip! Just when you think you have her beat, she grabs her big, wooden carpenter’s hammer and smashes it into your side! You collapse onto the ground, shuddering at the blow, giving her the opportunity to hop over and retrieve her staff.

Eventually, you let out a loud growl as you suddenly spin around, sending a long tear along the front of her coat with your sword. She squeals, stumbling back and blocking your next blow with her staff, only to open herself up for another blow! She seems to be stunned by how fast and brutal your assault was! Apparently, she was not aware of the sheer level of strength and speed the rot could afford someone. She couldn’t keep up with your savage blows, and eventually she was on the ground before you, battered and bruised. She wasn’t bleeding or anything, since she was the champion of her clan, and their shamans have granted her a pseudo-immortality. However, she was far too exhausted and defeated to resist you.

As you were about to land the finishing blow, and send her back to her clan grounds, you hesitated. You remembered what she called you earlier. ‘Disgusting’. You figure that should hurt, but… for some reason, someone considering you gross was actually a little exciting to you! Those filthy fantasies filled your head again, and you decided to see just how much you could gross her out. She deserved it, after all, after condemning so many of your people to the same fate. “Hmm… you think I’m ‘disgusting’, huh?” You said, sheathing your sword. Your face remains stoic, but on the inside, you were quite excited. "How's this, then?"

Groaning, Elyssia opened her eyes… to see your big, smelly paw hovering inches above her face! She can only let out the faintest yelp before you bring it down her snout, pressing it against her nostrils before she could let out a sound. Her yelp is muffled by your sweaty pawpads as she struggles beneath your paw. A strange feeling bubbles in your chest as you torment her with your stinky paw. It felt… amazing to dominate someone like this! Especially someone who truly deserves it. Of course, you know that this is merely the rot’s influence wearing down at your will… but this was so fun, it was difficult to resist.

Eventually, you finally lift your paw off her face, and she immediately gasped for fresh air, gagging, tears in her eyes. She had never smelled something so foul in all her cushy, aristocratic life! As she gags and coughs, trying to wipe the smell from her nostrils, you take a knee by her side, amused by her reaction. “You… filthy cur! You uncivilized swine!” She screamed, blown away by your sheer gall. You, a simple warrior, dared to inflict such… uncivilized, disgusting torments upon a legendary architect like her? “That was the foulest thing in the four clans!”

You let out a little, amused huff, almost cracked the slightest semblance of a smile. Right now, all you could think about was the ways you could disgust this oversensitive, snobby little rabbit. You’re quickly reminded of the torment that bear inflicted upon you, and how absolutely miserable it was to be on the receiving end. Your comrades were probably getting sat on in that village as you spoke, so it stood to reason that the rabbit deserved a similar fate. “My paws? The foulest thing in the kingdom? I’m flattered, but alas, no…” She watched in horror as you pulled up your banded leather skirt, revealing your furry hindquarters! “This is!”

Before she could react, you dropped down on her with all your weight! Her scream is muffled almost completely by your rump as she’s smothered in fluffy butt flesh. You let out a little gasp, invigorated by the sensation of tormenting some evil, snobby little rabbit beneath your rear. It was so uncouth… so dishonorable… and so, so hot! Your chastity was largely forgotten as you learned about the sheer ecstasy of the rot. Eventually, her wet nose was pressed right up against your puckered tailhole, and you let out a little coo at the sensation. It almost made you feel a little… gassy.

You hesitated. Were you really willing to go that far? It probably isn’t wise to let the rot have too much influence over you! Of course, it has to come out, one way or another. Why not let it rip while you have a, let’s just say, ‘captive audience’? Your body acts almost of its own accord, and you lift a leg up slightly, and hesitantly pass an embarrassingly loud onslaught of gas directly into the rabbit’s nostrils. Her squirms and muffled screams double in intensity, as she desperately tries to push you off of her, but is far too weak to do so. All she can do is lie there, and inhale every little bit of the foul stench…

Eventually, you finally stand up off of her, leaving her lying there, shivering in disgust. She could never even imagine someone doing anything so foul! As you look down at her, amused by the fact that you’ve knocked the smug rabbit down a peg, she opens an eye and stares daggers up at you. “... whore.” With an amused chortle, you wander over to your bow, and lazily nock another arrow and fire it directly into the rabbit’s chest. She disappears in a burst of light, being sent instantly back to her clan grounds, humbled and humiliated.

You were still shaking a little bit, overwhelmed by the excitement what you had just done had given you… but you take a moment to meditate, and soothe your nerves.

River takes 1 damage
Elyssia takes 5 damage
River is Victorious!


Eventually, you get your head back in the game, and proceed into the village. With the rabbit out of the way, it was a relatively straightforward task to scale the wall, though it did take a while.

You travel along the rooftops of the village, moving silently on all fours and staying easily out of sight. The wolf villagers below, clad in simple robes and tunics, all seemed miserable, and they flinched in fear whenever one of the felines walked by. Apparently, when one of the wolves made a feline angry, or even if the feline was just bored, they could expect to be farted on and tortured with sweaty paws and armpits for hours. You shuddered whenever you came across one of the felines tormenting a villager. However, you don’t bother with the small fries; not yet, anyway. Every group like this needs a leader. Cut down their leader, and the rest are vulnerable.

Eventually, you come across the tyrant; a big, brawny tiger, dressed in a big, fancy cape and nothing else. He was using one wolf’s face as a throne, while a harem of wolf girls catered to his every need, nervously complimenting him and feeding him grapes. You noticed the huge stockpile of food behind his throne, and for some reason, this above all made you furious! How dare he feast on fine cuisine while the villagers starve? This was the sorriest excuse for a ruler you’ve ever seen! Even if he obtained his position of power through nominally ‘legal’ means, you couldn’t allow his reign of terror to continue.

You had two ways of overthrowing him. You could either find out which legal loophole they had used to come to power, and then find a way to reverse it and get them ousted… or, you could simply shoot him and a few of his cronies with your bow, and scare away the remaining felines. Then, the villagers would be free to elect a new leader.

So which should it be? The violent or non-violent method?

112321112111.content:
You weren’t particularly intimidated as the four of them surrounded you. You’ve cut down over a hundred other bandits over the years, and these ones didn’t strike you as particularly tough… or smart, for that matter. The fact that they seem to have weaponized stench, however, intrigues you. If they manage to catch you off guard with that, they might actually do some damage. Then again, it might be fun to try and use their own techniques against him...

Your eyes narrow as you focus all your concentration on the battle, watching the four of them circle you like a pack of dogs. How predictable. All of them were too cowardly to rush you at once, so they’re trying to surround you and wait until you show their back. Well, you’re prepared to show them the fatal flaw in their little plan. You turn to the cheetah, pretending you’re going to focus on her… only to hear the lynx step forward, thinking he’s going to attack you from behind. Just like you planned!

Once he was close enough, you bent over, and he found himself blasted by a huge, devastatingly loud fart that seared his nostrils. These cats seemed to have only 1 point of rot, which meant you were about twice as smelly as they were. He immediately started coughing and sputtering, and you seized the opportunity, spinning around and slashing him ‘cross the neck! With a yelp, he fell to the ground.

The others seemed disturbed by how easily you dispatched their comrade. The tiger simply growls… but the cheetah is overcome with rage! “You... bitch!” She yells, before foolishly charging forward, her sword raised! The way she fumbled with her weapon was almost embarrassing. She obviously wasn’t used to the weight of her sword. You easily ducked under her swing, grabbing her by the waist and pushing forward, knocking her onto her back on the ground. The fall knocks the breath out of the feline, and in another moment, you’ve laid a paw down on her face!

She squirms beneath your foot, as you force her to breath in the stench of your sweaty paw. Meanwhile, you nock an arrow, and pull the string back, aiming it right at her chest. At any moment, you could let go of the string and end the cheetah. “Now. If you agree to relinquish your power, I’ll spare your little underling here…” You offer. You like to offer your opponents mercy whenever you felt it was safe to do so. Unfortunately, the tiger was too stupid to accept your offering.

“Never!” The tiger yelled. He was drunk on his own power, and seemed outraged that you would even suggest he give it up. He gestured to his last remaining underling, a panther, pointing at you. “Go! Kill her!” The panther nervously readied his sword, and charged at you!

Meanwhile, you can’t help but roll your eyes at the tiger’s stupidity. “Alright. If diplomacy isn’t what you desire, then…” You raised your bow, pointing it at the panther before finally letting go of the string! It pierced through his chest mid-charge, and the feline stumbled forward a few more steps, before collapsing onto the ground near your feet. The tiger looked furious, but stunned. All his underlings were lying limp on the ground, and the only one he had left was squirming beneath the onslaught of your smelly paw.

Triumphantly, you nock another arrow, pointing it at him. He realizes he can’t survive another blow like the first arrow. His entire life flashed before his eyes as he stares at the shiny “W-wait! Please! I change my mind!” He falls to his knees, begging you for his life. “I agree to your terms! I surrender!” How pathetic. He was willing to let others lay down their lives for him, but when it was his own life at risk, he was a coward.

You were disgusted. Such cowardice had to be punished. “Oh? My terms? My terms have changed…” You said, no longer willing to spare his life so easily. “I’ll grant you mercy if you relinquish control of this village… AND if you take your underling here’s boots off and take a big, long whiff.” Judging from the look on his face, his heart dropped the moment you spoke those words. For a second, it almost looked like he’d rather choose death. But with a sigh, he nodded, and stepped forward, ready to meet his fate.

You take your paw off the cheetah’s face for a moment, letting her gasp for air… only to drop your butt down on her face! This time, you hadn’t lifted your leather skirt, so her snout wasn’t pressed right up against your tailhole, but it was still quite smelly. The real point of this, however, was just to pin her down while you force the tiger to humble himself for you. You watched, sword ready, while he hesitantly got on his knees and slowly, reluctantly slipped off one of the cheetah’s boots. Both of you immediately recoiled at the smell! Apparently, when it comes to the rot, how the stench is spread out around your body is different for every person. Apparently, for the cheetah, 100% of the stench went straight to her paws!

The tiger was wretched and miserable when he looked down at her paw, trying his best to brace himself for what was about to come. Eventually, he works up the courage to finally lower his head, and press his snout up against her paw pads. He took the biggest whiff he could… only to practically howl in anguish at the smell! He immediately recoiled backwards after filling his nostrils with her stench, gasping and coughing like he’d just been poisoned, gagging like he was about to throw up. The stench was so terrible, it actually felt red-hot in his nostrils, causing him genuine physical pain.

You watched, amused, as he regained his composure. The poor bastard thinks he’s finished… but he was only halfway done. “Now, do the other one,” you demand. He gawked at you, blown away, looking like he couldn’t believe you were serious. But the stoic look on your face indicated that you were, indeed, dead serious. He tries to protest, but he couldn’t think of any argument he could make that wouldn’t get him immediately killed. So, begrudgingly, he gets down on his knees again in front of the cheetah’s hind paws. He hesitated for even longer this time, but eventually, he painstakingly managed to bring him to pull off her other boot.

He leaned back, taking a deep breath of fresh air… before suddenly slamming his nose forwards against her paw pads! Apparently, he decided to act like he was ripping off a band-aid; just get it over with as quickly as he could. Once again, he was brought to agony by the sheer smell, and this time eventually collapsed onto the ground, his brain numbed by the stench and exhausted by his reactions. With an amused huff, you finally lift yourself off the cheetah’s face, only to notice that she, too, is too exhausted to move, or even speak.

You wonder what to do with the two, defeated villains… until you feel someone tap you on the shoulder. You turned to see a few of the wolves in the tiger’s harem standing there. “River! We’ve heard about you! Oh, thank you so much!” The tiger’s head concubine, immediately stepping forward and wrapped her arms around you, planting a big kiss on your cheek! You were a little taken aback by her show of physical affection, especially since you were quite stinky, but you reciprocated, hesitantly hugging her back. Eventually, she stepped back, glaring at the two on the ground. “Please. Don’t kill them. They enslaved our village. Now it is fair that they become our slaves, no?”

You nod. Yes, you suppose that is a just fate for the two surviving felines. Hearing the commotion, this happened to be around the time many of the rest of the villagers wandered into the plaza, as they all quickly realized what had occured. You noticed a few others angrily kicking the tiger and cheetah while they were down. Eventually, a wolf comes with rope, and they tie the feline’s hands behind their back and cart them away. Meanwhile, many of the villagers cheered you on like you were some sort of hero. You didn’t take compliments very well, so you were a little uncomfortable as they cheered for you, but you did appreciate the way they showered you in gold.

Later, the tyrant defeated as the trade routes reopened, you stumbled from the town, victorious and feeling proud of yourself. 11232111211112.content:
The spiritual power of the lantern allows you to sense the heroes in this area...

Magna
Prestige: 2 | Rot: 3

Scarlet
Prestige: 2 | Rot: 3


Alarming, for sure. Scarlet was the leader of the bandit tribe, and the most wanted outlaw in Armello. Meanwhile, Magna was… well, Magna. If they were in the same place, that could only mean one thing; they were hunting eachother. You glance out over the town, just wondering where they were hiding. You pondered just how Magna would react if she saw you. Everyone, regardless of clan, was in this to win the throne. So just because you were both wolves didn’t mean she’d necessarily we be friendly…

Meanwhile, in the distance, dusk was approaching, and the purple clouds above you seemed to be growing closer and thicker. You should probably get indoors sooner rather than later. You retreat into a nearby inn, hoping that people didn’t mind your stench too much. Every time someone got a grossed-out look on their face when you walked by, it was… actually kind of a turn-on, actually. Still, you didn’t want to inconvenience people too much. The old turtle running the inn had a pair of noseclips on, so he, luckily, didn’t seem to mind your smell too much…

“Aye, missy. Aren’t you one of those champions?” The old, feeble turtle smiles warmly as you walk in. “Are you here looking for Magna?”

You raise a brow, a little confused. Why would he assume you were looking for Magna? Just because you were both wolves? “Why do you ask?”

“Well, she mentioned ya, so I figure she’s a friend o’ your’s…” The turtle shrugged. “If you want to speak with ‘er, she’s sitting right o’er there…” He pointed his cane right behind you! He can’t be serious, right? You turn around… and sure enough, there she was! Sitting on the bench was a veritable mountain of a wolf, standing at over a foot taller than you are thick with what you presume to be pure muscle. She had a stoic, almost bored expression on her face as she towers over you, seemingly unimpressed by your stature. You immediately step back and grip the handle of your sword, startled but ready for anything.

“I have no grievances with you, ranger,” she waved a hand, dismissively. Embarrassed, you move your hand from your sword and try to calm down. You knew why her enemies seemed to fear her so; she was truly an imposing figure.

“Neither do I,” you nod, curtly. After that, she simply stares at you in silence. The awkwardness grows more and more intense until eventually, you’re forced to break the silence. “Are you… here for Scarlet?”

“... mhmm,” she grunted, simply.

You don’t really consider Magna a terrible choice for the crown, from what you’ve heard about her. Sure, she seems to have an unnerving prejudice towards foxes… but other than that, she seems like a prime example of a wolf warrior. “Do you know where she is?” You perk up. “I can help you fight her.”

“I’ve killed her before. She came back,” she huffs, shaking her head. “Eventually, I will be so strong, she does not come back. Very simple.” Behind those stoic eyes, you can sense a deep and piercing hatred. Apparently, Magna’s really not a fan of Scarlet.

It seems Magna has a one-track mind. You’re not even sure if she cares about the crown as much as she does killing Scarlet. If you helped her with this seemingly important task, you might have a valuable ally… but how? Suddenly, you remember your scroll. “Well… there’s easier ways of getting rid of her than that,” you said, taking out your spell scroll and showing it to the wolf. She snorts, looking up at you, realizing what you were implying. For a moment, it almost looked like she’d cracked a smile.

While the rot rain poured down outside, you and Magna huddled together in the inn, discussing your plans. She smelled even worse than you did, confirming that she was, indeed, infected with the rot. “So… why are you targeting Scarlet in particular, anyway?” You ask at one point. Sure, she was the most wanted bandit in Armello, but Magna acted as if this was a personal vendetta.

She stared at you. “Her bandits robbed my son. Stole everything. Stabbed him in the knees and left him. He died of exposure in the wilds.” She said, simply, the emotionless, stoic expression never leaving her face. You could tell that whatever emotions she did have, she kept thoroughly bottled up.

“Oh… by the Wyld! I’m… so sorry…” You said, a little taken aback by her frank, nonchalant reveal of such tragic personal information. Your ears were pressed back against your head, as you suddenly sympathized by the huge woman.

“No. Do not be sad. Never get sad. Get angry,” she insisted. “I will get even with her. I will make things right. Then, I will feel… okay again.” You could tell she almost choked up at that last line. You laid a paw on her arm, silently expressing your sympathies, and she went silent.

Eventually, you got down to the nitty gritty of planning. Apparently, since the last time Magna killed her, Scarlet brought along an entourage of bandit around with her wherever she goes. She’s stopped at a compound on the other side of town to rest while the rot rain falls. One of you should be able to hold off all the bandits easily on your own, which would give the other the opening to get to Scarlet and cast your spell. After that, whoever hypnotized her would just need to survive for the next full day, and she would permanently enslaved. You were hesitate to assist another hero, but it was worth it to eliminate another clan’s champion from the situation completely.

The main question; who should be the one to hypnotize Scarlet?

112321112111121.content:
The choice here isn't entirely too difficult. As much as you felt Magna deserved to have Scarlet for herself, her Spirit isn't nearly high enough to be able to cast the spell. "Well, Magna...as much as we both know Scarlet deserves to suffer at you-"

She holds up a hand to cut you off, "It is okay. I...understand. I cannot cast the spell. I am not suited for sneaking anyways. So long as the fox suffers. So long as she cannot kill again. This will be her punishment. If I can not give it to her, a fellow wolfess is the next best thing." You can hear the disappointment in her voice. If it could be the other way around, you'd gladly trade places with her, but as it stands Magna can't cast the spell, and neither of you have any Moon Juice.


With the plan set, the two of you wait for the rains to stop before heading out towards the compound where Scarlet is taking refuge. When the place is in sight, you quickly climb up the nearby buildings and watch from the rooftops, waiting for Magna's distraction. You don't have to wait long before she lets out a mighty bellow, slams her shield into the ground (which causes a small crater in the road), and charges straight in! The first bandit she hits goes flying when her shield slams into his body! As the others move to engage, you almost forget that you have a job to do too. Tearing yourself away from the action, you go back to leaping from rooftop to rooftop. Scarlet appears to be in the top floor of the building you're moving towards, so entry from the roof should be easy at least. You pick off a few archers trained on Magna as you creep along till you make it to Scarlet's hideout. The window isn't locked, strangely enough, so you slip right in. You look around for Scarlet, only to hear a soft, sultry voice next to you.

"So...you must be the great ranger...River, right? You know, I had expected a scarred, scratched up brute like the other two. Instead I find myself pointing my sword at a woman almost as gorgeous as me." Sure enough, when you turn your head, you see Scarlet pointing her blade at you. In her off hand, you see an opened flask of the very same wine you'd helped yourself to yesterday! Yet, despite her Rot score now being 4, you don't smell a thing! At first you think its because her paws are sealed away in black leather boots, but something else catches your eye...a glowing talisman around her neck. "Like my Wyld Talisman? Well, if you and I can have a calm, civil discussion maybe followed by some...not so civil activities, I might give it to you. Consider it a...token of my affection."

From what you've heard, Scarlet is just as skilled of a fighter as yourself. And while that charm seems to be suppressing her Rot, she still has a sword to your neck. Plus, the cord looks to be deliberately made so she can tear it off at a moment's notice. With a nod, the two of you take a seat at the small table in her room. Scarlet, understandably, keeps her sword pointed at you. There's a lantern on the table just like yours. No wonder she knew you were coming... "So, perhaps you can help me understand all this. Why exactly does the howling wall of metal and meat outside want me dead so badly?"

Your eyes narrow and you snarl. "Hmph. Figures...you don't even remember having your bandits kill her son? You probably weren't even there. They say you're a great fighter, but you just hide behind your men like all the rest!"

Scarlet raises an eyebrow at you, "she had a son? Huh, I can't imagine a man capable of climbing THAT mountain. Did she top? I bet she topped. Now THAT would have been a sight to see." She chuckles to herself a bit before continuing, "Regardless, I gave no such order. I only united all the bandit clans a very short while ago. A good amount of them either haven't gotten the news yet, or have left their clans. Turns out some people don't enjoy taking orders from a former slave."

Former slave? You'd always heard she was just a noble-turned-bandit. Still, that doesn't really answer all your questions. "Alright, so why didn't you just tell Magna this? You've apparently fought before."

Scarlet scoffs, "Well she wasn't exactly in a talkative mood last time! She just yelled "murderer" and charged me with that shield of hers. Besides, even if I were to tell her that those bandits weren't under my rule, do you think she'd listen? I'm not sure if you've noticed, but she isn't particularly fond of foxes."

That is a fair point. Magna definitely doesn't like vulpines. You aren't sure why she's telling you all this though. "Fair enough. So, I take it there's a reason your sword hasn't been thrust into my throat yet, yes?"

Scarlet smiles at you and stands up before sheathing her blade. "Well, aside from wanting answers, I have a proposal for you.
No doubt you plan on using that Mesmerize scroll on me, and while I'm not particularly fond of the idea of being a slave again, if its to a woman as fine as you, I suppose it wouldn't be all that bad. Still, I do rather enjoy my freedom, so how's this? You let me go, and take my lantern over there. Show it to Magna and tell her that I saw both of you coming and escaped. I'll be waiting in the woods near the town being attacked by that skunk Bane. I'm sure you've heard about that. Give me my lantern back there, and I'll be sure to properly thank you for your help." She winks at you and smiles as she waits for you to make your decision.
