1123211121111212.content:
You can tell when somebody’s trying to manipulate you. Scarlet’s the most wanted animal in Armello, so obviously she wouldn’t be above lying to your face. Besides, she was your enemy, and it would benefit you greatly if she was eliminated. If anybody had to take the throne, the bandit clan would be one of your last choices, rivalled only, perhaps, by the rat clan. Seeing the uncertainty on his face, the skinny vixen seemed smug, believing she’d tricked you into helping her… only to freeze up in horror when she watched you unfurl the scroll. “W-wait! No!” She said, jumping forward, as if she hadn’t anticipated you would actually use your spell.

It was far too late, though. Reciting the incantation and pouring all your magic into it, Scarlet suddenly stopped in her tracks, her eyes wide as she felt the spell worm its way up into her brain. Soon, her arms went limp, and her jaw just hung open as her eyes fogged up and became grey. She drooled a bit, just standing there in place. You were a little confused. You expected her to be hypnotized, but she just looked braindead. “Scarlet?” You asked, waving a paw in front of her face.

The sound of you calling her name seemed to almost wake her up from a trance, and although her eyes were still foggy, she smiled dimly at you. “S-so… you got me. After… all those years reuniting the tribes… this is how you want to finish it, huh?” She groaned, obviously a little out of it. She was clinging to the last bit of consciousness she still had. The devoted look on her face was almost creepy. “I… can’t be angry. I literally just can’t. This spell… it’s inside my head. Making me devoted to you. By the Wyld, you’re so damn beautiful…”

Seeing that the spell had been successful, you toss the scroll aside. You’d heard this was a kink for some, but you, on the other hand, were quite unnerved by the whole thing. Especially, when she suddenly stumbles over to you, and wraps you in her arms, nuzzling her head on your shoulder. “Mistress… I’d do anything for you…”

“O… kay…?” You muttered, a little big uncomfortable. You let her hug you for a while, but it didn’t seem like it would ever again, so eventually you just had to push her away. Now, her eyes were filled with nothing but love and devotion, and her tongue was hanging out of her mouth. “W-well… you can start by following me outside.” She nods eagerly, ecstatic to prove her devotion. She copies your every footstep exactly as you walk down the halls of the building. As you approach the front door, you don’t hear any commotion, so you figure Magna must’ve been victorious.

“When we get out there, say something like… I don’t know. ‘Sorry for killing your son’, you know?” You whispered to her, and she nodded. With that, the two of you stepped out of the double doors in the front of the building, to find Magna surrounded by dead or unconscious bandits. She immediately looked outraged when she laid eyes of Scarlet, but she resisted to urge to strike her down, knowing that doing so would free the vixen.

“Murderer,” she muttered, stepping forward. “In fact, the once great leader of murders… now reduced to a simple slave. How pathetic.”

Immediately, Scarlet flopped to her hands and knees in front of Magna. “I’m so sorry for everything I have done! I have seen the error of my ways!” Scarlet immediately begged. “Please! I deserve any punishment you could give me, a thousand fold!” Magna seemed a little taken aback. This seemed incredibly out of character for the vixen… but, she assumes, her action was just the result of the mesmerization.

“Hmm… punishment, huh?” The wolf said, tapping her chin. Torturing Scarlet, even a hypnotized version of her, would definitely be cathartic. “Ranger, do you think you could give me, perhaps, a half hour alone with this murderer?”

“Oh, yes, of course. I’ll meet you at the inn,” you said, relinquishing Scarlet to the maiden’s care. “Do whatever she says, now, alright?” You whisper to the vixen, who nods.

Suddenly, Magna steps forward, grabbing Scarlet by the neck and lifted her up in the air. “Alright, now, murderer. I want to see you squirming and begging for dear life. You hear me?” She said, and Scarlet nodded, immediately starting to squirm and whimper in the wolf’s grin. This was the first time in your life that you’d seen Magna smile. It was a disturbing smile. With that, she retreated into the compound with the fox in her grip, and you could only wonder what kind of fate Scarlet was about to endure.

As you walk back to the inn, you notice a wanted poster… with your face on it!

WANTED
River
For use of outlawed magic


You pulled it off of its post, confused. What in the four clans? Mesmerize was outlawed? How did the king already know what you’ve done? How did he already print out these posters? You knew he had eyes and ears everywhere, but this was ridiculous. Maybe he had a way of detecting whenever somebody performed certain types of spells? Well, overall, this wasn’t good. If the king’s guard were after you, it would be much more difficult to survive the next 24 hours required to permanently enslave Scarlet. Especially when you’ll probably also have her bandits after you, too…

To make matters worse, you were feeling a little bit frail and groggy after performing that spell. You might be a little more vulnerable to attacks for a while. (-2 Body)

You take refuge in the inn, trying to use the extra time to plan out your next move. Eventually, over a half hour later, Magna walks into the inn, and Scarlet stumbles in behind her. Scarlet looked exhausted and miserable. She had been battered and bruised, and stunk like a regular fart cushion. You’re a little concerned when you realized she only had 1 health left! “Hey! Magna!” You complain. “You weren’t supposed to do any damage!” If Scarlet dies in the next 24 hours, she’s free!

Magna takes a seat down in front of you, looking happier now that she’s vented her feelings out on the beaten fox. “My apologies. Things got carried away,” she shrugged.

Meanwhile, the fox sat down next to you and hugged you, a few tears streaming down her face as if she’d been traumatized. “M-mistress…” She whimpered, hugging you close to her for comfort. You pat her on the back.

“There, there. It's okay. You're safe now,” you reassure her, feeling a little bad. She was a bandit, though, so this was the life she chose. Eventually, Scarlet calmed down a bit after her torture, lying down on the booth and laying her head on your lap as she rested. She was actually quite beautiful, you had to admit.

“Do not worry. I will ensure the two of you survive the next 24 hours,” Magna nods. “By the way, you don’t happen to know where Thane is, do you?”

You glance at her. “Um… no. I haven’t seen him,” you shrug.

She sighs. “Then it may already be too late for him,” Magna says, leaning back in her chair. “You see, we have an, err, undisclosed opponent in this race, it seems. And I think I may have identified who it might be…” She reached into her bag, and pulled out a little medallion, dropping it on the table. It had a familiar star-like symbol on the front, and it seemed to be cracked into two pieces. You inspected it curiously, not understanding its meaning.

“What… is this?” You ask.

“It’s Fang’s,” she says, simply. You look up at her, a little stunned. She couldn’t be implying…? “An entire village… most of its people wiped out by stench I can’t even imagine. When asked, the survivors told me a hulking, black wolf was responsible.” She explained, grimly. “I only had the faintest glimpse of him while searching the forests, but… I feel Fang might still be out there.”

“N-no…” You whispered. “Fang died years ago!”

“You really believe that?” She frowns. “When great wolf warriors are corrupted by the rot, the rest used to be told that they simply died, or disappeared. Surely, you’ve run into enough exiles to know this is not always the case.”

You leaned back in your chair, huffing. Fang’s still alive… overcome by the rot? Slaughtering villages? Spreading madness? It was a lot to take in… “Worse, still. I think he has a particular vendetta against Thane,” she explains. “He probably believes that Thane stole his rightful place as ruler of the wolf clan. Which is why I find it so worrying that nobody seems to have seen nor heard from Thane in a while.”

Thane was always an annoyance to you, but he was your superior, and you couldn’t let him have who-knows-what kind of torments inflicted on him by a crazy wolf. “I was planning on finding him after I dealt with Scarlet,” Magna concludes. You were a little upset with her. Why didn’t she tell you this earlier? If you had heard about this, you would’ve never wasted your time with all this Scarlet nonsense!

You sigh, looking at the sleeping vixen who was resting her head on your lap. “Well… if we go and try to find them… you know that if I die, Scarlet goes free, right?” You say.

“If you want to take that risk, I won’t stop you,” she responds, simply.

She definitely didn’t seem to mind seeing you naked, so you basically acted like she wasn’t there, slipping out of your armor and bathing beneath the chilly water that dripped down from a bucket above the showerhead. Once the stench dissipated, you decided to relax and try to read a book you found in the nightstand to keep yourself distracted from your lecherous thoughts. After bathing, Scarlet had to spend a long time drying off all of her fluff, but eventually, she emerged, a smile on her face, wearing nothing but the talisman. You gawked at her body while she turned the lights off and climbed into bed beside you. She let out a happy coo as you let her cuddle up against you, feeling the incredible warmth and softness of her fluff.

It’s been a day or two since you’ve ‘blown off some steam’, and the rot has been causing an aching need to slowly grow in your loins. Would it really be ethical to, er, do anything with her, though? After all, she was hypnotized. Then again, she did seem very enthusiastic, and eager to please you in any way she could. She smiles and wags her tail every since time you even pay attention to her. You figure it would probably make her very, very happy to be able to prove herself to you. “You k-know… if you’re interested, there is… one way you could serve me,” you offered, nervously.

She looked at you blankly for a moment, before realizing what you were asking. Her tail immediately started wagging, and a smile dawned on her face. I thought you’d never ask~” With surprising eagerness, the vixen suddenly disappeared beneath the covers, and you could only watch as her form snaked its way around beneath the covers, until she was propped up between your legs. She giggled and purred as she planted little kisses up along the inside of your thighs, making your way towards your womanhood. In death, you are rocked by spiritual visions of the Wyld. You can’t really interpret what any of it means, but some of it seems to be oddly prophetic. It not only shows you glimpses of the heroes you’ve met so far, but those you’ll meet in the future, along with foreshadowing which you’re going to befriend and which you’re going to end up slaying. You don’t know if this was truly a Wyld vision, though, or just some sort of surreal fever dream. There was no point in trying to interpret these prophecies, anyway. Whatever happens, happens…

Apparently, you feel your spirit get pulled from the astral plane and sucked back into a physical form. It was unpleasant, really, like being pulled from a huge, free field, and locked away in a tight little cell. You’d almost rather stay dead. But whatever, you had a job to do. The moment you’re plopped back into your old form, you gasp loudly, your eyes flying open to find yourself naked in bed, in some kind of hospital room. Compared to the dungeon, it was nice to have a little fresh air. You can only wonder how Magna and Scarlet are doing…

You glance around, looking through a window to see doctors wearing… gas masks? Suddenly, you realize how absolutely powerful your stench was now. It must fill the entire room! You climb up groggily out of bed, stumbling over a mirror, and looked into your eyes. You were immediately a little alarmed. Your iris was… pure black! You part some fur on your arms, looking at your corrupted veins. They were pumping with glowing purple, dark energy! There was no doubt about it; you’ve been completely corrupted by the rot!

...

A couple minutes later, one of the doctors steps into the room… only to find you completely missing! He can still smell you in here, but he can’t see you, no matter where he looks… until eventually, you suddenly drop down on him from the ceiling, pinning him to the floor! He let's out a muffled yelp, looking up at your crazed, horny eyes. You were corrupted by the rot, now, and the wolf knew your darkest impulses had considerable sway over you. “Mm! Hey there, handsome!” You said, straddling him on the floor, wrapping your arms behind your head. He was dressed in thick armor and a mask; you are as naked as the day you were born.

He’s silent beneath you, feeling a strange mixture of turned on and terrified. “Oh, so you’re the strong, silent type, huh? I like that!” You taunted. It was like you were a completely different person! Before, you were stoic and emotionless; now, you were overcome by the passion of the rot. “So you’re a doctor? Well, doc, I think I’m coming down with the most horrible of maladies; excessive thirst!” While you pinned him to the ground, you started undoing his shirt. “The only cure is some big, strong alpha wolf bending me over the bed and rutting me like his bitch. Thing you might be up to the task?”

You can faintly see his eyes peering up at you from beneath his mask’s goggles. He was an odd mix of terrified and aroused. On one hand, one of the most beautiful and legendary heroes in the clan was lusting after him. On the other, she was only doing it because she was overcome by the Rot! Then again, his dick’s argument seemed more eloquent than his brain’s, so he really had no choice. “S-sure,” he muttered, unable to resist.

With that, you suddenly tear his clothes to shreds with your claws, leaving bits of fabric scattered all over the ground! “Fannntastic, then!”

A few minutes later, another doctor walks into the room, glancing at a clipboard and doing some routine checks… only to find his colleague bending you over the bed, his balls slapping against your ass as he rutted you like mad! The room was soundproof, so he hadn’t heard your loud, shameless screams and moans as the other canine pounded into you. The other doctor immediately froze in shock, his clipboard falling from his hands and loudly clanging against the ground. This caught your attention, and you glanced over at him with a smirk on your face, still panting as the other wolf dominated you.

“Oh! Feeling jealous, big boy? Don’t worry, you can go next~”

…

You wake up in the hospital bed again.

You look up, drowsily, to see one of the wolf doctors looming over you, checking your vital. Your heart immediately leaped in your chest, remembering the previous events. “W-what happened?” You muttered.

“You got up, saw yourself in the mirror, and immediately fainted,” the wolf shrugged his shoulders, nonchalantly. You consider how this was possible for a moment… before letting out a sigh of relief! You hadn’t really banged every single doctor here! That had all been a dream! The hottest dream you’ve ever had, sure, but still just a dream.

You spend the night with the doctors, re-orienting yourself to your new body. Using the Wyld, they crafted a whole new body for you every time you perished; and since you’ve signed your soul over to your clan, they were able to just plop it into your new body whenever you needed it. They got you fitted with another ranger outfit, and early that morning, they let you get back to work. You stumbled out of the clan grounds, thinking about everything that’s happened. Well, might as well get your head in the game. You were basically back to where you started, except this time, you had much better stats, gear, and a much better knowledge of how Armello worked nowadays. You were intending to make the most of it!


Then, in the distance, you spot that damn squirrel walking up to you. “Oh, come on!” You muttered to yourself.

Eventually, he waddles up to you. “Hey, hey, hey! Good to see you again, River!” He gives you a big, toothy grin. “I just wanted you to know that you are-”

“Yes, I know. I’m entitled to provisions,” you say, “but right now, I think I’d rather have an EXPLANATION for how you keep finding me!”

He stares up at you, blankly, as if not knowing that you’re so concerned about. “Um… just by coincidence?”

You glare at him. “Impossible.”

“Hey, if something’s coincidental enough, it’s, like, indistinguishable from magic!” He shrugged with a little chuckle. “Good job with that Bane, anyway! Those three heroes you rescued have been returned to their clan grounds, safe and sound.”

You sigh, taking a sit on a nearby tree stump. The squirrel’s secrecy was… frustrated, but you suppose he’s an ally. “... was Thane among them?”

“That, I cannot tell you,” he wags a finger, before excitedly presenting his bag. He jiggles it around a bit, and it noisily jostles with its contents. “What I CAN do is offer you two new provisions!”

Well...I still don't think you're ready to pay the price for that kind of information, buuut..." He leans in close and whispers to you, "You've basically gotta be my stink slave for half a day. 1123211121111212131122222131.content:
You raised a brow, incredulous. Does this little squirrel really believe he can be stinkier than a Bane - a physical embodiment of the Rot? You doubt he’s even smelled a Bane before. He may have some exceptional powers, but you doubt stench is among them. Besides, the more Rot that flows through your veins, the more your nostrils are desensitized to foul smells. Overall, you weren’t intimidated by him in the slightest. Your only hesitation was that being his slave would waste half of a precious day. However, if you were able to knock the prestige leader down a peg, it would be worth it.

“Alright, strange little rodent,” you said, taking a knee in front of him, completely unafraid. “I’ll take your wager.” He looks quite excited to finally find someone who says ‘yes’!

“Alright, miss River! Just know that there’s no turning back now…” He says, almost giddy with excitement as he lifts up a paw and pulls off his ring. Just a half second after he slides it off, you are suddenly assaulted by an unbelievably vile stench! Black magic runs through his veins, and his eyes turn black and glowing purple as a sinister smile dawns on his face. By the four clans, he was more rotten than you could’ve ever imagined! He must have at least 10 points in Rot! You were about to protest, but the squirrel snapped his fingers, and suddenly your hands were tied behind your back, and some tape appeared over your mouth! He must have some kind of spell…

“Don’t worry, I’ll start ya off slow!” He giggled, amused by the sight of the noble hero restrained before him. He plopped himself down, propping his feet up. “Why don’t ya start by sniffing my boots?” You sigh, knowing that, since you agreed to be his slave, by Armello’s law you had little other choice. You hesitated, before leaning forwards and taking the tiniest sniff. Ugh! Even though he had his boots on, the smell of his paws still seared your nostrils, making you gasp and gag in pain and disgust! You couldn’t even imagine what they smelled like when he took his boots off!

“You call that a sniff? C’mon, you’re supposed to be a warrior! You can do better than that!” He teased, wriggling his paws a bit. You growl, gritting your teeth, before leaning forward and taking another, bigger sniff. This one fried your brain just as hard, but you were able to bear it now. He didn’t seem satisfied, so you just kept sniffing, always feeling like you were on the verge of throwing up as your nose was assault by the muffled stench of his sweaty paw pads. “Oh! It’s nice to be the one getting pampered for a change. Man, being a courier’s hard work. It gives you a lot of funny stories to tell, though! In fact, just last Thursday I…”

He spent a ridiculous amount of time having you worship his smelly boots, while he droned on and on about all the adventures he’s had as a courier. Most of his stories were fairly boring and mundane, and whenever they were interested, his disorganizing and rambling way of speaking left you confused. Eventually, you just tuned him out and focused on your task. “Hey! Have you even been listening?” The squirrel eventually pouted, and you looked up at him, caught off-guard. He shook his head, crossing his arms. “Such a disrespectful slave. In fact… why don’t you take a whiff of this?”

He reached down, and suddenly yanked his boots off! You held your breath, staring hesitantly at his bare, sweaty little paws. Even though you weren’t breathing, you could feel the stench coming off of them. The squirrel had a disturbing grin on his face as he excitedly anticipating you taking a sniff. With extreme hesitation, you leaned forward and sniffed his paw pads… only to practically cry out of in pain! He was right; his paws made that bane’s ass smell like febreze in comparison! The stench worked its way up to your brain, and you were gasped and panting in agony as it felt like it melted away at it.

With a giggle, the squirrel slipped his boots back on. “Y’see why I wear boots, now?” He taunted you, as you slowly calmed down, trying to meditate your way through the pain. “Tired of sniffing my paws, huh? Well, you should probably have a lie-down. Sitting on the ground’s getting a little uncomfortable.” You sigh in relief, thinking he was giving you a break. You lied on your back on the ground, still tied up, but enjoying the fresh air… only to open your eyes and see the squirrel’s butt hovering above your face! In that terrifying instant, you suddenly realized what he had meant!

You let out a yelp as he plopped his butt down on your face. Squirrels were small, but bottom-heavy, so your face was pretty thoroughly smothered beneath his rear. Luckily, he had his trousers on, or you assume his butt would kill you in seconds, just like his paws would. Still, it smelled absolutely terrible beneath him, and you couldn’t but whimper and squirm as he wriggled his big butt on your face, getting comfortable. “Huh! You actually make a pretty comfy chair! I’m impressed,” he says. “Well, I gotta take notes of all the provisions handed out today, so we may be here a while…”

With that, he pulls out a little journal and starts writing. Meanwhile, you were pinned beneath him, forced to breath in the stale air beneath his sweaty, fluffy butt. It was gross, but at least it wasn’t painful. At least, not yet, anyway! Eventually, your entire body shuddered when the squirrel passed a bit of gas! It just the tiniest, quietest fart, and still it stunk just as foul as his paws did, even through his jeans! “Oops! Excuse me!” He giggled as your yells of pain were muffled beneath his rump. With that, he went back to writing, using you as a glorified chair.

With that, you spent the next few hours being used a chair or paw worshipper, occasionally getting farted on, or worse, having to sniff his paws with his boots off. You could tell that he could kill you with his stench in an instant if he wanted to, but he was usually holding back. Even still, you could slowly feel your consciousness slip away, as his stench does more and more damage to your addled mind. You were quite rotten yourself, which was the only thing saving you so far. Still, as noon approaches, you wonder if you’ll be able to survive...

The time you spend serving this rodent is long, agonizing, and painful. Your nose is subjected to swampy armpits, filthy feet, and noxious farts over and over again to the point where you're almost certain you'll go insane! The worst part is, you know he's holding back. If you think the punishment for failing as a hero is bad, man...you should see what they'd put me through if I killed you here! Sooo...you're free to go." He stands up off of you and you immediately start wheezing and coughing as he puts his ring back on. "But know this, Miss River. You failed as a Hero, trying to take the easy way out. By the way...Griotte."

You wave your hand in front of his face and he suddenly shakes his head. "H-huh? What...happened? Last thing I remember was that squirrel looking me in the eyes...where'd he go?"

You sigh, "It's a long story, Moof. We need to get going. Come on." The pig man nods his head and scurries along behind you as you once again descend from the mountains back into the rest of Armello. 112321112111121213112222213112.content:
You keep thinking about your brief adventure with Scarlet and Magna. It seemed like sort of an anti-climactic end… but you had to get your head back in the game. Both of them were your rivals on your quest for the crown of Armello, and it was probably a good thing if they kept eachother occupied for the time being. Meanwhile, your first order of business was to go cash in that document. Griotte was the absolute LAST person in Armello that you’d want to become Queen. Even before the rot, she was as crazy as crazy could be. Then again, being the prestige leader might attract unsavory attention from other heroes attempting a prestige victory…

That was just a risk you had to take. You turned in the document as well as a couple gold coins to an official, essentially bribing him to spread nasty rumors about Griotte. That would surely knock her down a peg… but you still probably aren’t the prestige leader. You had to focus on gaining a ton of prestige today! Then, you could choose tomorrow's declaration, so you didn’t have to keep dealing with the fallouts of the other hero’s choices. Speaking of which, just why is Mercurio on Wolf Clan territory? You don’t want his greedy fingers anywhere near your clan. He must be up to something…

Luckily, you knew these grounds like the back of your paw, so you knew just who to go to to find out the latest rumors. Apparently, Mercurio is here representing the rat clan for some kind of… charity event? You heard that there were talks nearby, so you decided to stop by the charity and event and see what’s going on. When it was time to say his piece, the audience immediately seemed to be charmed by his demeanor, handsome and refined appearance, and alluring accent. You didn’t understand it, though. To you, he seemed like most rats; smug, smarmy and untrustworthy.

You walked out of the event without hearing any evidence that he’s committing any wrong-doing however, so you decide you might as well not bother him. Later, just as you’re about to walk into one of your favorite old bakeries, though, you notice him walking out. Much unlike how he appeared at the charity event, Mercurio now had an entourage of wolf girls following him around, all giggling whenever he made even the most innocuous of comments, infatuating by him. You rolled your eyes as you stepped in, to see the old baker, Ari. “Good afternoon, Ari,” you said, taking a seat at the stool across from her.

The plump old wolf seemed to be in a good mood over something, and smiled at you when you walked. “Oh! Why, it’s wonderful to see you again, River!” She smiled. Luckily, here, your stench was drowned out by the sheer delicious scent of the she-wolf’s cooking. “Oh, I just met with the most wonderful official from the Rat clan! I used to not think very highly of that clan, but I’ll tell ya, River, he sure convinced me!”

You raised a brow. “Is that so?” You ask, noticing just how enthusiastic she seemed to be. “It didn’t seem like he had anything to eat. What did he walk in here for?”

“I think he just came in to take my finest brooch! Precious family heirloom, that was. Probably going to fetch a pretty penny,” she said, tapping her chin.

“Took it?” You asked, confused. “Like, you sold it to him, or…?”

“Oh, no. He stole it! Slipped out right out of my pockets while were chatting. Such a clever young man, he is!” She giggled, cheerfully. You were taken aback! She was stolen from, and she didn’t even care?

“Uh…” You tilt your head. “Shouldn’t you be upset?”

She shook her head, holding up a paw. “Nah! I mean, usually I would be. But he didn’t act like a thief or anything! He acted like he just really, really needed that brooch,” she nodded. “I’m sure he stole it for a good reason!”

You were… disturbed. You knew that the rat was manipulative, but he was even able to trick people into being happy that they got their stuff stolen? Just what kind of trickster was this guy? “... mhmm,” you nodded, trying to act calm even though you felt a rage brewing in your chest. Eventually, you drop off your stool. “Uh, sorry, Ari, but I think I’m going to have to come back…” Before she could say a word, you disappeared out the door, eager to catch up to Mercurio before he could disappear. A few other wolves gave you weird looks when you got down on all fours, tracking the scent of his entourage.

Eventually, you’re a little confused when you discover their trail leads down an alleyway, for some reason. Feeling a little worried for the fates of his little entourage, you journey down the alleyway… only to be a little shocked by what you find. Tucked away in the most remote corner of the clan grounds, Mercurio is huddled up with the wolf girls, his fancy outfit unbuttoned to reveal his chest. Most were simply giggling and running their paws over his vaguely muscular form, but one was making out with him, and another was on her knees between the rat’s legs, her long tongue lapping at something unseen - it didn’t take a genius to guess what.

They all seemed to be having fun… until one of them spotted you! “Hey! What the hell? Mind your own business!” One of them yelled at you. Before you knew it, all the wolves were jealously trying to drive you away, as if defending their man.

Before they could get too angry, though, Mercurio calmly raised a hand, silencing them all instantly. With a sly chuckle, he stood up, his frankly impressively large, pink manhood still fully rigid as he greeted you, still wet with the wolf’s saliva. “Now, now, girls, calm down. There’s more than enough for everyone!” He teased, before turning to you. You noticed he, too, was wearing one of those amulets that cancelled the stench of the rot. You should get one of those someday. “Ah! Well, if it isn’t the legendary ranger, River! I have heard of your incredible exploits. Now, doll, I know you rangers are trained to suppress such feelings, but if you were interested in me, you could’ve just said so…”

“Don’t call me ‘doll’,” you growl.

He quickly realized that the usual flattery and flirtation he tried with most girls wasn’t about to work on you, so he quickly changed tactics. “O-of course! My sincerest apologies! I meant no offense, truly,” he apologized. “I… take it you didn’t come back here for - as you wolves say - a ‘roll in the hay’?”

“I’m here because you stole a precious family heirloom from that bakery back there,” you said, crossing your arms, “and I’d be surprised if that’s the only thing you’ve stolen around here.”

“Oh, no, no, no! You misunderstand! What I did was not stealing!” He held up two paws, shaking his head. You hated how condescendingly he seemed to speak, as if you were some kind of moron simply because you were a wolf. “They were simply unintentionally and unknowingly donating to my cause!”

“What cause?” You ask.

“Imagine an Armello where there is no poor! No sick! No injustice or inequality! And an Armello where, if I may be so frank, such a brave and noble warrior like yourself will be well at home! That’s the future I’m envisioning! That’s Armello under Mercurio!” He smiled proudly, placing a hand on his chest.

You’re unimpressed. “You’re running a charity that just funds your own quest for power?”

“Well, nominally, the charity funds are supposed to go to local orphanages,” he shrugs, “but surely, no one would mind me ‘redirecting’ some of those funds to an even higher cause!”

You snapped. Not only was he stealing things, but he was misappropriating charity funds? Funds that were supposed to go to orphaned pups, no less? “Alright, that’s it!” You say, reaching for your sword… only to realize it’s not there anymore! “Hey! What the…?” You glance around, a little stunned… only to notice Mercurio proudly holding up your sword, taunting you with it. You freeze in place, realizing that the rodent had somehow managed to steal your weapon while you were distracted. You try not to make any sudden movements.

“I would like to thank you for your charitable donation! Why, this is a fine piece of craftsmanship, indeed!” He said, admiring the shiny sword in his paws.

“Give. Me. Back. My. Sword,” you growled.

He smirked up at you. “Make me,” he muttered. You were about to just shoot him with your bow… but on second thought, you noticed the wolf girls in Mercurio’s entourage pulling out small daggers, steely looks on their once giggly faces. Apparently, they were willing to defend the rat to the death. You didn’t want to kill them, though; they were innocent young women who had simply been manipulated by the rodent. But how else were you going to disarm this situation?

Unfortunately for him, it seems you often pass gas in your sleep. The poor pig was in for a looong night…

A few hours later, you were awoken by a powerful, familiar stench. You looked up, only to lock eyes on a squirrel’s puckered tailhole! You can’t even let out a yelp before his butt drops down on your face, and your smothered beneath him as he wriggles around trying to get comfortable. “Hey, River! Heard you killed three other heroes last afternoon. Pretty impressive,” he smiled. “Of course, not impressive enough to prove you’re a real hero! Sooo…” You didn’t have the chance to brace yourself before that tailhole slid open, unleashing a torrent of the foulest gas directly into your nostrils! The squirrel had no mercy, and within seconds, you were fully unconscious…

You woke up somewhere unfamiliar, but the stone floors, ornate architecture and royal decorations betrayed the fact that you were somewhere in the palace. Looking around, you noticed there were some cards by your feet, presumably left by the squirrel. Picking them up, you felt a slight chill when you read the titles - Plague Bearers, Roxy's Recruiting and Bastard Sword. You heard someone quickly approaching, though, so you tucked the card away in your pocket. Looking up, you see that jackal again. You couldn’t help but think she looked rather attractive. “River. Good to see you have awoken. You would not want to keep his majesty waiting,” she nodded at you.

When you stood up, she handed you a shiny nose clip, enchanted to resist the magical effects of the rot. “Here. You’re going to want to keep these in at all times,” she said, and you obliged, clipping it over your nostrils, squeezing them closed. You followed along with her down the ornate halls, admiring the palace’s beauty. “When in the king’s quarters, remain quiet and respectful. Do not say a word unless his majesty asks you a question. Do you understand?” You nod, feeling increasingly nervous as you step into the king’s chambers.

There he was, hunched over in his throne, looking down so a shadow is cast across his face, obscuring his eyes. He is definitely no longer the good king you once knew. His fur looked matted and unwashed, his clothing torn and ragged. His veins were visible and pumping with black, tar-like rot. His pupils were completely black, and his eyes were very red and veiny, giving him a very frightening appearance as he looked up at you. You stopped in your tracks, overcome by the sense of dread just being around the lion. How were you ever going to be strong enough to face him?

The king just stares at you for a long, long time. He had an almost lustful look in his eye as he sized you up. Eventually, he spoke. He said. He spoke surprisingly eloquently, but you knew that if you tempted his temper, he would unleash his true madness.

“Don’t try to be secretive with me, River. I know what you’re planning. My spies have kept track of your every movement since you began your quest of regicide.

I am no fool. If I wanted, I could have all twenty of you assassinated on a whim, and your clan grounds burned and salted.. but no. You heroes and your petty squabbles are deeply amusing to me… and if one of you ever happens to become powerful enough to seize the throne, well, let the chips fall where they may. Of course, that doesn’t mean I can’t try and make things a little more interesting. In fact, that is part of the reason I called you here today…

You are currently the most prestigious and popular hero in all of Armello. That means you have the potential to be my future wife. Because of this potential, I’d like to get a look at how you think. So, today, I’m going to let you pick my royal declaration. Just to get a glimpse at how you’d run the kingdom…”

Mysterious hooded figures present you with a few strange options written on scrolls. The choice you make here will affect the entire kingdom, but you do not want to test the king's patience. You must choose quickly, based just on the vague titles.

1123211121111212131122222131122122121114.content:
It would probably be best if you used this time to gain new equipment from the blacksmith, or learn strange trickerys from the spymaster. Something about the jackal, though, was alluring to you. You just couldn’t get her out of your mind. Eventually, your curiosity and intrigue overwhelms you, and you can’t help but ask the rabbit to take you to her. You find the jackal with a pair of reading glasses one, hunched over a typewriter with a concerned look on her face, busily typing away.

Whatever passion she had for her job has slowly been chipped away by the years, ever since the king began his descent into madness. It must be exhausting trying to hold a kingdom like this together, and the jackal looks like she never sleeps. She’s certainly not as ‘charismatic’ as you expected one who entertains foreign dignitaries to be, but the look in her eyes betrayed an almost scary degree of wit and intelligence.

Her face remained expressionless when she looked up at you. “Ah, River. I did not expect to see you again so soon,” she says. “Is there something you require of me?”

You awkwardly stand in the door of her messy, cluttered office. “Perhaps you could offer some… information?”

She sighs, pushing her office chair back and standing up. She obviously didn’t want to stop what she was doing, but you were brought here by the king himself, so she didn’t have any choice but to follow your every request. “I may not be able to provide you with provisions like many of the others, but I believe I can answer some of your questions. Come, let us retreat to my study.” She walked out of the room, gesturing with a paw for you to follow.

“Okay. Thank you for your time,” you nodded, following her down the hall. Eventually, you retreat into a cozy little study, the walls lined completely with books about politics, economics and related subjects. A great, big grandfather clock ticks constantly in the background, as the two of you take your seats in big, comfy leather chairs. You sigh in relaxation as you get settled in, while the jackal stares at you expectantly, anticipating a question. You try and make one up on the spot. The way she said ‘provisions’ earlier reminded you of someone... “That courier… who is he? How does he always know where I am?”

“Well, first of all, you should note that the king has spies everywhere. In every town, in every forest, in every swamp. Nothing escapes his gaze,” she says. “Anyway, the squirrel is named Brabble. The rot, combined with his considerable cleverness, has afforded him very useful powers. He’s capable of a degree of precognition and teleportation, among other things. If he was more ambitious, he would make for an unstoppable warrior. But for some reason, he is content being a courier.”

Another concern strikes you. “No offense, but… once I’m done making a declaration, does it really benefit me to be spending much time around here?” You say, trying not to sound too upset. “I mean, there’s already so little time in the day. I don’t want to fall behind…”

“We noticed you tend to sleep for exactly eight hours a night. Wolves have very fine-tuned internal clocks, you see. We simple woke you up here earlier than you would've normally woken up, and the court mage cast a simple spell on you that made up for the difference in sleep,” she explains. “To put it simply… no. You will be sent back to your inn at exactly the same time you would’ve normally woken up. You won’t fall behind the other heroes.”

Another concern. “Do you think Griotte will… come after me?”

“Griotte was the wife of one of the most prolific barons in Armello. She has spent her entire life in the lap of luxury, and prefers to keep it that way. Her morning trips to the palace seem to be the highlight of her days,” the jackal warns. “I think that, yes, once she realizes that you’re the new prestige leader, she will be aggressively hunting you down. I suggest you keep your lantern close at hand, and remain cautious. She can be deceptively sneaky for a woman of her ‘size’.”

This next question, well, you weren’t sure if it was a good idea to ask. But you figure you might as well try… “The king already knows what I’m planning, so… would you mind if I asked you for advice on how to, say, ‘seize power’?”

“Do not be fooled by the size of his blade. He can swing it with incredible speed. Like a true predator, every time you miss or fumble an attack, he will take advantage of it. Thus, I recommend you bring along gear that negates misses,” she explains without hesitation. “Despite the fact that he has a lot of health, you should not focus on offense too much. Defense is just as important, if not more so. Remember that even if you manage to defeat the king, you still will not be revived if you die on palace grounds, so if you both mortally wound eachother, the crown will simply go to the prestige leader.”

You were pretty taken aback that she was at liberty to tell you all that! You guess the king must really not mind you planning to overthrow him. Apparently, he’s amused by the whole thing. “Well… I guess you should tell me about yourself. What kind of thing do you do around here?” She didn’t seem to like to talk about herself, but obediently, she obliged. She went into all the various, boring details of her job, and described how she came to her position in the first place. You perked up when she described serving the ‘carnal needs’ of foreign dignitaries, if they so request. “W-wait, so… you offer those sorts of ‘services’?”

“Mm, yes. And from your tone, I’m assuming you’re interested.” You immediately blushed and stared down at the ground in embarrassment, trying not to be titillated any further by her beautiful, amber eyes. “No need to be embarrassed, River. I know you wolf clan warriors take vows of chastity, but I know first-hand just how powerful the licentious impulses symptomatic of the rot are. It is considered unhealthy to keep them repressed. Instead, experts suggest you find ways to release this ‘tension’ in a healthy manner.” With that, she stands up, and takes a knee before you.

“Just lie back and relax, ranger,” she says. You were a bit stunned by how quickly she agreed to such a scandalous thing… but you found yourself unable to turn her down! All you could do was bite your lip and silently urge her on as she pulled off your skirt, revealing your pusssy to the cold, open air. She dug her head up inbetween your thighs, and the experience that followed was… interesting. She certainly didn’t have as much passion as the vixen did, instead eating you out in the most formal of manners, as if it was an obligation. You could not deny the sheer ecstasy of feeling her glide her long, smooth tongue along your clit, however.

This was your second time with a woman, so now you sort of knew what you wanted. Thus, you felt comfortable whispering instructions to her, telling her when to slow down and speed up, and exactly how you wanted her to lick you. She quickly grew accustomed to your desires, and soon, this was rivalling even the night with Scarlet in terms of sheer ecstasy. You tried your best not to make too much noise and alert the other staff of the palace, but with the jackal’s expert tongue exploring your sex, it was difficult. Eventually, you squeak out a little warning, before tensing up in your chair, loudly gasping and whimpering as your body was wracked by climax. You only barely managed to resist howling at the sensation…

Eventually, you went limp on the chair, panting softly. By the four clans, after everything you’ve been put through over the past couple days, this was exactly what you needed. You spent the rest of the hour speaking with the jackal, even asking her to ‘service’ you once more before your time was up. Eventually, although you wish you could enjoy her company forever, the big grandfather clock started to loudly ring, signifying that your time here was over. Suddenly, her demeanor changed, and she tore you from your chair, throwing you onto the floor.

You watched, stunned in horror, as she slid her boot off and stood up. “Times up,” she said, emotionless, as she presses her paw against your nostrils and takes off her ring. Your entire body immediately tenses up as the smell assaults your nostrils! You wriggle underneath her, but her paw has your head firmly pinned to the ground, and your screams were almost completely muffled by her sweaty paw pads. Eventually, you slip into unconsciousness…

… only to wake up back in your inn room, with a considerable headache. Lying next to you was Moof, still comfortably slumbering like nothing had happened. The only evidence of your trip to the palace was the fact that all of your items were gone. You lie there in bed for a while, thinking about the events of this morning. Scarlet, the jackal… you had never been all too interested in men. Perhaps your preferences lied in women, instead? Before the rot, such a thought would be inconceivable for a ranger… but now, the thought of settling down with some beautiful vixen or she-wolf was oddly exciting to you.

You get up, preparing for another big day. You hoped to finally be able to leave this village… but you sighed when you noticed the lantern start to glow again. Someone else was here. Great. You check to see who else dares to tread on the territory of the wolf clan...

121.content:
The cities of the rat clan were bustling with activities, every street crowded to the absolute brim with crowds of citizens. It was even more overpopulated than the rabbit clan… but many would consider that a strength. Every rodent around only cared about their own business, trying to focus on their own little world in an effort to ignore just how small they were in the grand scheme of things, as they trudged along the street beneath a gloomy, ominously red night sky.

Of course, the surrounding rats were all roused from their stupors at the same of a nearby casino entrance being loudly smashed open. A familiar rat, Mercurio, was sent flying out the doors as if thrown, landing with a yelp on the concrete below… and following soon after was a furious-looking wolf, all muscle and fury, looming slowly down the stairs towards him. “Give me the fuckin’ gold back, you cheating bastard!” The powerful, muscular wolf shouted angrily at Mercurio, as he lay there on the ground. “First you steal my girl… then you steal my last bit of gold? Don’t think I don’t know you were marking cards!”

With a groan, Mercurio tried to lift himself to his feet, muttering a bit as he was still wracked with pain from the throw. “P-preposterous!” He managed to choke out, clutching his side as he sat up on his knees, one hand braced against the ground. “I’ll have you know I’m a man of class! I would never- mph!”

He let out another muffled yelp as the wolf suddenly grabbed him by the throat, easily lifting him up off his feet with incredible strength. Mercurio was forced to look into those furious, glowing eyes as the wolf digs his claw into the fur of his belly, threatening to disembowel him. “Tell me where you hid MY gold or I’ll gut you like a fish.” He growled.

“Markus, Markus! Old friend! No need to resort to violence!” He gave a sheepish smile, giving it one last attempt to talk the wolf down. “Tell you what… how about a rematch? If you win, you can have all your gold back and more!”

The wolf’s eyes narrowed as he held him close. “No. More. Games.” From the sound of it, he was, indeed, probably a hair’s breadth away from just cutting Mercurio open.

Mercurio was a tiny bit frightened for the first time in a while, seeing that the wolf was definitely serious about this. He definitely wasn’t just gonna talk his way out of this one. “F-fine! Fine! Don’t kill me! You can have your gold back!” He relented, holding up his hands, before slowly reaching into one of the pockets of his vest. “In fact, I have it right here in my pocket- HIYAH!”

The wolf suddenly tensed up when Mercurio suddenly produced a concealed dagger from his pocket, taken by surprise as the rat plunged the blade into his chest! “Augh!” The wolf stumbled back, releasing his hold on Mercurio… but the rat kept a hold of his paw. With every bit of his strength, Mercurio grabbed the dazed and pained wolf… and practically roared as he reared back, sending the wolf flying right over the edge of the nearby docks! The wolf let out one last yelp as he was flung into the lake below… and that was the last anyone saw of him, the water around turning scarlet.

Panting, with adrenaline still rushing though his veins, Mercurio turned back to the crowd, all gawking at the display. “You all saw ‘im! He was out of his mind! It was self-defense, you see?” He called out, and a few of the towns members just gave approving nods, before they all continued on their way. Nobody really paid what had just happened much mind. Not like such acts of violence were rare around these parts. In the end, the wolf was just yet another body clogging up the city’s river.

Overall, that definitely wasn’t how he was expecting his night to play out.

But at least he got his fair share of gold… and he finally got that unpredictable wolf, Markus out of his hair. All he wanted to do now was to retreat to his apartment and just relax with a nice, cool drink… but as he made his way there and stumbled inside, his nose twitched as he smelled something. Something… well, quite foul. He stood there, sniffing the air, before he finally recognized it. “... I can smell you, you know. You’re not being sneaky.” He said, simply, to whoever was there.

On cue, a panther woman emerged from the shadows with a smug little grin on her face. She was one of the most beautiful women in this town… which only made it more tragic to Mercurio that she’s recently begun to experiment with the Rot, and thus, she now smelled absolutely dreadful. “By the blood on your vest, I see you haven’t changed a bit, Mercurio…” She purred. “Still out there getting into trouble?”

He wiped his dagger off a bit with a little grumble, annoyed by the panther’s tendency to let herself into his apartment whenever she pleased. “Oh, Agatha, darling. You used to be so… ladylike,” he sighed, looking at her now mangy fur, as he grimaced a bit at the stench he could smell even from across the room. “Why did you get tangled up in all that… that rot?”

“The power,” she breathed, holding up a fist with a smug grin on her face. “All the power in the world. Far more than even you’ve been able to command. And you’ll need that sort of power… if you’re going to capture the throne.”

He sighed, remembering his vow to claim the throne of Armello in the name of the rat clan. He sort of forgot about that recently. “I don’t need to resort to dark magics just to capture that accursed throne. I’ve already worked out a deal with the local barons. They’re putting together several levies-”

“Doesn’t matter how many armies you put together when a warrior of the rot can knock them out with a single fart!” She laughs, interrupting him. “Trust me, Mercurio… you’ll give in, one way or another. But that’s not what I’m here for.” She was about to step closer, but he lifted a hand up, signifying that he didn’t want the smelly feline anywhere near him. With a giggle, she kicked a small bundle of papers across the floor over to him, which he curiously picked up and read over. “I know I don’t work for you anymore, but… I put together some new contracts for you anyway. It was almost sad to see how lazy you got when I wasn’t there ordering your around… hah! You know what they say about idle paws…”

Well… he supposes he hasn’t really been doing much serious, productive work ever since Agatha left. He frowned as he looked through the contracts she’s brought him, eyeing each one over carefully. Couldn’t hurt to get one of them done in the morning. “Alright. Thank you, Agatha. But remember, I don’t require your services any longer.”

“Whatever you say~” She cooed, as she stepped out. With that, the rat sat down to look over the notes, and decide which contract he should embark on in the morning.

Sana says, nodding to the Tower Shield.

Though now that she didn't have anything to do but sit around and rest, she couldn't help but have her thoughts go back to her stench, or to Sana's attractiveness. It was a calm night, and Griotte might enjoy it more if not for the small part of her that regretted not staying with that absolutely gorgeous, curvy...

"Curse these thoughts! I'm better than this. I'm not some slut who'd fall for the first good looking man or woman she sees!" Griotte exclaims, a scowl on her face. That outburst did a good job of taking her thoughts away from Sana or smelling her stinky body at least.

Griotte passed through one section of the woods and into the next, before leaving the forests entirely as she came across the town she was looking for. It seemed she was just in time too, as there was a big congregation in the center of town, and a makeshift gallows set up on a stage just for the execution. A rather corpulent pig stood up there, dressed in fancy clothes. Well, that was the Baron alright, but who was it that going to die tonight if she doesn't intervene? Well, who else but a Squirrel lady dressed in dark robes and some actual armor. Her eyes glowed purple and she showed signs of corruption from the Rot. This was the Rat Clan loyalist who Griotte was to save? What a strange thing to have to do... And it looked like she was working on her escape, not that the Baron noticed her attempt to.

Griotte was having second thoughts about the affair, but she knew that she couldn't just watch. After all, that would mean failing this quest, and if she were to fail, she would be coming out of it empty handed. Anyway, being able to spite this oaf of a Baron was enough of a reward to make up for the fact that she would be saving what looked to be a Warlock.

She had time to make a decision on what to do, since it seemed like the Baron was taking his time rambling on before things started. Probably trying to delay while he waited for whatever thug he hired to act as executioner to arrive at the stage.

Most people around her backed off, having no interest in standing near someone who had such a foul scent. Griotte finally reached the front of the crowd, and stares up at the Baron with a frown. "Well well well, what do we have here? A fool and his efforts to sabotage the Rat Clan while disguising it as some sort of good deed meant to help save others from the Rot." Griotte says, everyone's attention on her and the Baron.

'What! Who are you, and what is this insolence!" The rotund Pig asks, looking down on Griotte.

"Do you really not know who I am? I am the Baroness Griotte, and I'm here to defend the name of this fine member of the Rat Clan, and stop you from unjustly executing her!" Griotte says. "Surely you lot can see that his is a farce. This baron has just dressed up one of his goons as a Rot cultist, got someone skilled in magic to make her eyes glow purple, and made a big deal about how his efforts captured her and helped save you all from the Rot!" Griotte claims. She hoped that she was charming enough at five wits to convince the people here that she was right, and that this Execution should be stopped.

To them, it was completely reasonable for the Baron to be doing this as an attempt to garner good publicity.

Soon enough, there were cries of outrage and accusations coming from all over the crowd, and Griotte smirked as she walked up the stage to go and free the Warlock. She cut the ropes which bound the warlock using her Butcher's knife, something she always kept on her just in case she'd need to use it as a weapon or tool. Up this close she could smell the Rot which corrupted the Squirrel. A rotten miasma that smelled of rotten, centuries old cheese and fish. A smell which made Griotte want to gag. "Well, it looks like you're free to go now. But why don't you join up with me? You know, as thanks for rescuing you from that oaf of a Baron." Griotte suggests, before gagging at the stench.

Anyway, my name is Sinvah Sorrel, and I suppose that I shall accompany you on your journey, Baroness Griotte." She said. The Rat Clan hero nodded, slightly weirded out by how... Normal? The woman was able to act. But she guessed that it would be difficult to be someone who worked with the rot if you acted like a hedonist with no desires except to have stinky sex with everyone you meet. Though now that you've recruited the Warlock, you could feel the corrupting influence of the Rot truly take hold within you. The Rabbit Clan
The rabbit clan was once thought to be an ancient myth, until the entire civilization suddenly emerged one day, fully-formed, as a powerful force in the kingdom. Their artistry and craftsmanship is renowned, prolific due to a philosophy that emphasizes deep introspection as well as a progressive pursuing of one's own potential. If you ever pass by a particularly beautiful painting or other work of art in Armello, well, chances are, it was probably the work of a rabbit...

Amber
Fight: 3 | Body: 5 | Wits: 4 | Spirit: 4
Born into nobility, Amber distinguished herself from her peers by having apparently no interest in the cozy, peaceful life typical of the upper crust of society. Instead, she had higher ambitions; adventure! Hunting priceless treasures, exploring ancient rumors, slaying terrible beasts... every aspect of adventure filled the little rabbit with excitement! So, while such a refined and humble noblewoman might look out of place compared to the other heroes, she more than holds her own through sheer determination. Many are awed to see a fine young woman unleashing skilled attacks upon her foes, all while donning a fancy dress and waving an umbrella around...

Barnaby
Fight: 4 | Body: 5 | Wits: 4 | Spirit: 2
He was once known as a child prodigy, his natural skill at tinkering making him briefly famous throughout the kingdom. That was a long time, ago, however. Now a young man, he's come to the sobering realization that when surrounded by other tinkerers, his skills were merely average. This realization has only renewed his vigor, and he's dedicated himself to creating gadgets that are bigger and badder than everyone else's! What he lacks in natural strength or agility, he more than makes up for with all the clever devices he uses to tip the scales in battle, eager to seize the crown and finally prove his genius once and for all...

Elyssia
Fight: 3 | Body: 5 | Wits: 5 | Spirit: 3
Take any of the most lavish and legendary feats of architecture accomplished in the past couple decades, and chances are it was designed by Elyssia herself. The rabbit kingdom is known for having the most brilliant architects in Armello, and Elyssia was prodigious even among them. Now, that's all well and good, but the question remains; why is an architect pursuing the throne of Armello? The answer is; nobody knows. Elyssia's a fairly quiet and tight-lipped woman, so her reasons, it seems, are entirely her own. Some speculate, though, that she simply loathes the mediocre, poorly-planned architecture of the other clans, and wants to unite them all under her artful eye...

Hargrave
Fight: 5 | Body: 5 | Wits: 4 | Spirit: 2
This old hare has always been exceedingly proud, and justly so. For decades he's been one of the most influential earls in the rabbit clan, and his rap sheet is truly impressive. However, in his old age, senility has slowly seized him, and his ego has perhaps become somewhat unwieldy. His memory seems to exaggerate some of his feats, and some it manufactures whole-cloth, convincing Hargrave he's done fantastical things like slaying dragons and saving the world. Thus, he's convinced that a man of his imaginary stature ought to be the king of Armello, and due to their respect for the elderly, nobody in the clan has had the gall to tell him any differently...

14.content:

The Bear Clan
Most species consider magic to be a simple curiosity; a tool useful for its practical purpose, and nothing more. Bears, however, consider magic to be the force that allows for life in Armello, and holds the natural world together. Living deep in the wilderness, they zealously worship the Wyld, the mysterious force from which all magic flows...

Brun
Fight: 4 | Body: 5 | Wits: 3 | Spirit: 3
Bears are usually known for their stoicism and quiet wisdom; Brun, however, is all sound and fury in his pursuit of the powers of the Wyld. He was banished from the Wyld Tree for daring to question the religious preconceptions of its elders. To put it into perspective, being unable to visit the holy tree, from which all magic flows, is considered one of the most humiliating and devastating blows a bear can be dealt. He feared that he would live out the rest of his life isolated and without spiritual purpose. However, during his desperate meditations, he discovered other methods of harnessing the Wyld; and now, overcome by fury, he bends those forbidden methods towards getting revenge on those wronged him...

Sana
Fight: 2 | Body: 6 | Wits: 3 | Spirit: 5
Vows of chastity. Vows of poverty. Vows of obedience. Sana's strictly adhered to the tenants of the Wyld for her entire life... but, as the rot encroaches across the kingdom, it seems like she'll have to abandon her vows, for the greater good. She's spent the last few years trying to cure those corrupted by the rot using an old spirit stone, but this trial has proven largely fruitless. She simply doesn't get enough power out of a single stone, especially now that she seems to have drained it of its energy. No; she has to find more. Perhaps, once she's collected enough of these spirit stones, she'll be able to finally put a stop to the rot. In order to accomplish such a feat, however, she fears she'll have to stare into the abyss...

Ghor
Fight: 3 | Body: 6 | Wits: 3 | Spirit: 4
Ghor is unique among the heroes in the fact that literally nobody seems to know who he is. He seems to be a quiet, and frankly dim-witted little bear who's spent all his time isolated in nature, researching the Wyld through his own means. His insistence on spending his every single waking moment connecting with nature, however, has over the years afforded him prodigious magical power, unlike what most shamans would be capable of in their entire lives. Thus, in their desperation to stomp out the rot, the elders have convinced Ghor to make an attempt on the crown, despite his desire for isolation and severe aversion to politics, and indeed, conversations in general...

Yordana
Fight: 2 | Body: 5 | Wits: 4 | Spirit: 5
A cackling crone whose sheer skill at magic and mastery over fate has allowed her a seat among the elders of the clan, despite the hesitations of the rest of the council. While they disagree with her methods, no one could deny the results. What she lacks in the physical stature typical of her species, she more than makes up for in magical prowess. Her curses are legendary, and feared across the kingdom even by those who typically do not believe in the influence of the Wyld. This has made her prospects of grabbing the crown of Armello surprisingly likely, a fact which both intrigues and terrifies her peers in the bear clan...

The Bandit Clan
The outcasts and exiles from the other species, this clan is united by nothing but a shared sense of greed! These dastardly ne'er-do-wells haven't done much to garner the hearts and minds of the people; in fact, they're just as likely to rob and torment random civilians as they are other heroes! A few more ambitious members, however, have higher aspirations in mind for the rag-tag little group...

Scarlet
Fight: 4 | Body: 5 | Wits: 4 | Spirit: 3
It's only natural that a fox like Scarlet be so greedy. After all, she once lived in wealth and opulence, only to have it torn from her. She was born into nobility, but she was disillusioned towards high society by her drunkard of a father; the same father who sold her to raiders to pay off his gambling debts! Her fiery ambition never left her, however, and eventually she proved herself to be incredibly cunning and skilled. Over many decades, she honed her skills until she was a truly legendary hero... and now, all of the old bandit tribes have been united under her rule.

Sylas
Fight: 4 | Body: 5 | Wits: 3 | Spirit: 3
Sylas the otter used to be a simple fisherman, but he, too, was disillusioned when the mad king of Armello had his entire village burned to the ground, massacring everyone he's ever known, simply because he stole a particularly tasty fish from the king's property. Sylas was the only survivor, and he lingered for days, letting misery and hatred well up in his spirit until he could take it no longer. Now, Sylas has turned from a humble fisherman into the most feared and rutheless killer in the clan, knowing no mercy and offering only a swift death, if you're lucky. His objective is simple: revenge, at all costs.

Twiss
Fight: 2 | Body: 4 | Wits: 5 | Spirit: 4
Twiss the squirrel was kind and innocent, as far as bandits go. A petty thief, who, in her mind, stole from the rich and gave to the poor; and there was nothing she couldn't steal. Her unmatched skill gave her a legendary status in the kingdom, and many citizens even came to respect her, in a weird way. This all soon came to an end, however. When the king was maddened by the rot, he ordered a brutal crackdown on thievery, and Twiss could only watch as everyone she knew was massacred with rhyme, reason, and definitely without due process. Devastated, she's decided to apply her skills to a new objective...

Horace
Fight: 5 | Body: 5 | Wits: 3 | Spirit: 2
Horace the badger was once a legendary warrior, renowned by all throughout the kingdom. He was the king's right-hand man, and served in many epic battles in service of the kingdom. But as the kind grew maddened by the rot, his paranoia led him to believe Horace was conspiring against him; and thus, he ordered his guards to have the badger killed in his own quarters. Horace, of course, escaped with ease, but the treachery of his former comrades dealt a great blow to his spirit. Now, he bides his time with poetry and contemplation,
as he prepares to destroy the king he spent so long defending...

info.description:
So, for those of you who aren't familiar, Armello is a strategy game that takes place in a world of anthropomorphic animals. In each game, four heroes, from a current roster of 20 (only 8 of whom are in the base game), compete to be the first to slay, purify, absorb, or succeed a king who has been corrupted by the Rot. The Rot is a sort of mystical disease that twists the mind and the body. It drives people mad and also destroys their body while at the same time giving the host otherworldly power. If you've got 20 bucks to burn, it's a decent time sink.

Now that's the normal version of Armello. This interactive will, of course, be far more sexual and stench-kink oriented in nature. (You can all thank the Rotten Fog spell card for giving me this idea.) As such, I will be scratching the Kingslayer victory path, unless people can think up a decent way to implement it. Basically, instead of doom, gloom, destruction, and madness, the Rot instead makes you smell AWFUL. It also gives a major spike to your sex drive and sexual openness. Banes are still a thing though! And they can take the form of more animals than just crows! So, when the king contracted the Rot, he declared stench and hedonism to be the new law of the land, giving some people new ways to obtain power, and others a reason to set out and put a stop to the madness.

Now, this isn't going to be a simple strategy-game type thing. You actually can, and probably will, adventure through places, talk to people, and take on quests and the like. There also won't be a limit to quests like there is in Armello, so stats will not have a cap.

Now, on to the various possible endings both for victory!

Spirit Stone: The prude's way to win. Collecting four stones will fill you with Wyld energy. When filled with this, anything you touch will be cleansed of Rot. Corrupted Heroes will return to normal, Banes will melt at your touch, and the king can be restored to his former self. Be warned though, a single point of rot gained by a spell, or other means, will bring you out of the Spirit Walker state, and you'll have to find another stone!

Prestige: Victory through fame, fortune, and fucking! Upon gaining 20 Prestige Points, you will be able to approach the king and ask for his hand. So long as you have the necessary points, he will accept, and you will rule at his side!

Rot: Usurp the king by using his own laws against him! If you can defeat the king in combat while your Rot score is 10 points higher than his, or while wearing one of two special items I will discuss later, you can kill him and take the throne for yourself, ensuring that rot will rule!

Those three conditions are how you can win and get a happy ending. Now here's all the ways you can get a bad ending~ Keep in mind that, unless one of these conditions is met, any hero killed will resurrect at their Clan Grounds.

Beat to the Punch: If someone else claims a Prestige or Rot victory before you, you, along with any still living Heroes will be enslaved by the victor. If the Victor wins via Spirit Stone, everyone just kinda...goes home.

Enslaved: This can come from a variety of sources. Hypnotized for a whole day by another Hero without you, or said other hero dying and being returned to clan grounds, thus breaking the spell; being beaten by slavers during a quest or peril; fulfilling the conditions of certain rare treasures, or by losing to another Hero in combat when said hero has more than 5, but less than 10, more Rot points than you.

Royal Execution: The rot runs deep in the palace, and it interferes with the magic that keeps heroes alive. If the king manages to beat you, you will not resurrect back at the Clan Grounds.

Bane Slave: Similar to the palace, Bane infested dungeons also will not allow resurrections. If a Hero is beaten by a Bane in a dungeon, and has at least 1 point of Rot, the Bane will enslave them.

Bane Kill: Similar to the above, but if a Pure hero is beaten, they will not survive the Bane's stench.

Hero Kill: If a Hero beats another Hero while their Rot score is 10 points higher than the Hero they beat, the stench, and corruption of rot will kill the other Hero, and they will not resurrect.


Now, on to the various stats Heroes have! They can be increased by spells, items, or quests. Rot and Prestige can also be increased through other means.

Fight: Your general martial prowess. There's no dice in this, so it's mostly just there to show how hard someone is to beat.

Body: How durable you are, and your maximum Health.

Wits: Your cunning and Intelligence. Higher Wits make it easier to convince people to impede other Heroes, or assist you, for gold!

Spirit: Your magical attunement. Every night, if your magic is below this number, it will be replenished to this amount.

Rot: How corrupted you are. Every point of rot is an effective +1 to fight. Go above 4, and you become Corrupted. At this point, Spirit walkers and Stone Circles can hurt you or kill you very easily. It's at this point, your stink can start to kill, but to permanently end someone, there must be a difference of 10. Can be increased by quests, losing to Banes, beating Banes after becoming Corrupted, defeating a Rot infected Hero while being infected yourself, using dark magics, or using tainted treasures.

Prestige: Your renown across the world. It can be increased through questing, bribery, or by spreading your legs and letting word get around about how good of a lay you are.

Magic: How many spells you can cast a day. More powerful spells cost more to cast, but dark magic generally increases Rot instead of consuming Magic.

Gold: How much money you have to buy equipment, hire people do do your dirty work, or spend on other pursuits. It's gained through quests or dungeoneering mostly. There's no owning settlements in this, but they can still be fortified, making other Heroes have to take longer to pass through them. Settlements can also still be terrorized by wandering Banes.

Spells, Trickeries, Followers and Items will be left up to writer discretion! Though as stated earlier, I do have two items I wish to just put here for writer knowledge. One is the Succubus Pendant, if you make someone cum while wearing this, you can take their soul and either crush it to permanently kill them, or absorb it to enslave them. The other is the Deathstench Ring, wearing this confers an immediate 5 Rot, and treats every victory as though you beat your opponent with 10 more Rot than them.

I will allow a few kinks other than stench torture, but please be reasonable. Scat and urine are off limits as always, and while yes, there can be gore in fights, it should in no way be overdetailed or fetishized.
